Name: Coda
Description: Meet Coda (known to her foster as Opera) ‚Äî the sweetest soul waiting for her chance at a real life. Opera is a gentle, about one-year-old mixed-breed pup (very likely with some AmStaff in her), and she is looking for a patient, loving home where she can finally feel safe. Opera has been through more than any dog should. She was found with a severe injury to her neck and brought to a county shelter in Tifton, Georgia, where she got surgery to heal. She is 100% better health wise, but the emotional scars still remain. She arrived scared, shut down, and unsure of the world ‚Äî but every day she shows us that she wants to trust. With quiet routines, kindness, and a calm environment, she is already making small, meaningful steps forward. Opera has not shown an ounce of agressivesness. Her instinct is to freeze when she is unsure or scared. She loves her food, responds beautifully to a soft voice, and finds comfort in having a cozy spot of her own. Once she feels secure, her sweet personality shines through. Opera will absolutely blossom with someone willing to give her time, consistency, and reassurance. If you‚Äôve ever wanted to witness a transformation ‚Äî to help a fearful dog discover joy, play, and confidence ‚Äî Opera is your girl. She deserves a family that will love her gently, at her pace, and celebrate every victory along the way. If your home has patience, love, and calm, Opera will give you her whole heart. Help her start the life she‚Äôs always deserved. Name: Stream
Description: Meet Miss Stream! The biggest snuggle bug, looking for her forever BFFL. Stream is a one-of-a-kind pet. She has a big personality and SO much love to give. She deeply cares about her people, and doesn't have a mean bone in her body. Stream sleeps the whole night through cuddling her little lovebug body right by yours. Stream is also incredibly adventurous and loves to run around the city saying hi to people and sniffing all the smells. Personality & Characteristics: Sweet, calm, happy, smart My foster dog is good with: Crate, commands My foster dog is: Crate trained, almost fully house trained, low shed 3 Keywords for your pup: Sweet, happy, and loving Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 6 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Barks outside when she gets excited at other dogs, in house when she is getting settled into her new environment and then fine. Name: A Boy Called Rivi (Rivington)
Description: Introducing Rivington, affectionately known as Rivi! This handsome boy holds the record as our longest resident at Waldo's foster care. Currently finding love and care in NYC with his foster family, Rivi is ready to embark on a new chapter in life, seeking a forever home away from the bustling city. He is such a special dog and he deserves a wonderful home! While his foster family adores him, they believe Rivi will flourish in a quieter environment, free from the hustle and bustle of city sounds and traffic. He gets anxious around loud sounds. With his intelligence, loyalty, and excellent leash manners, Rivi is the perfect companion for a home with minimal foot traffic or a family experienced in caring for dogs. This clever pup is already house trained and crate trained, making him a well-behaved addition to any family. Moreover, Rivi has undergone professional training, which we are thrilled to extend to his future adopter throughout their lifetime together. The training facility, conveniently located in NJ, will provide guidance and support during the transition to a new home. If you're looking for a smart and devoted furry friend, Rivi might just be the perfect match for you! Reach out to Waldo's to learn more about this amazing canine and offer him the loving forever home he deserves. Let Rivi's next chapter be filled with joy and love, as he eagerly awaits to meet his forever family! ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. The application can be found at http://www.WaldosRescue.org and once you are approved to adopt you will be put in touch with the foster to see if it‚Äôs a good match. We are a RESCUE not a shelter. We conduct veterinary and personal reference checks during the application approval process. We are unable to contact every applicant for every dog. We will select the best applicant for each dog, based on the dogs needs. Waldos Rescue Pen is a 501c3 whose primary focus is rescuing dogs from the euthanasia list from high kill shelters throughout the United States

Name: Sugarberry
Description: Meet Sugarberry ‚Äî affectionately known as ‚ÄúSuggy‚Äù! Sugarberry is a 6-year-old southern sweetheart who recently traded country roads for city sidewalks ‚Äî and she‚Äôs been stealing hearts ever since. She‚Äôs gentle, affectionate, and loves nothing more than long walks, belly rubs, soft head scratches, and, of course, her favorite treats ‚Äî duck jerky and cheese! While loud noises can startle her, Sugarberry has been adjusting beautifully to the hustle and bustle of New York City. She‚Äôs fully potty trained, friendly with all people and most dogs, and loves spending time with her humans. Sugarberry would thrive in a calm, patient home that can continue helping her build confidence around other dogs. In return, she‚Äôll offer endless love, loyalty, and quiet companionship. If you‚Äôre looking for a gentle soul with a big heart who‚Äôll fill your home with love, Sugarberry is your girl. üíó üêæ

Name: Sycamore
Description: Meet Sycamore! üêæ Sycamore is a 5-year-old Jack Russell Terrier with a bright mind, a playful spirit, and a heart ready to grow. At 15 lbs, this energetic little guy is a true JRT‚Äîfull of curiosity, cleverness, and a zest for life. A former breeder dog, Sycamore has made incredible progress in just a few weeks of fostering. What was once a shy dog who wouldn‚Äôt accept touch is now happily letting himself be petted (with a little patience) and even carried. He‚Äôs eager to be part of the action, loves to play, and is highly motivated by food‚Äîtreats are the key to his heart and his learning! Sycamore is crate trained, sleeps quietly through the night, and is almost fully house trained. He enjoys walks and exploring the outdoors, though new sights and sounds can sometimes startle him. A patient family who understands his need for gentle guidance will help him continue building confidence. He thrives with other dogs and would especially love a home with a confident canine companion to show him the ropes. A yard where he can safely run and burn off energy would be ideal. If you‚Äôre looking for a smart, food-loving, and affectionate companion who will blossom with patience and love, Sycamore is ready to meet his forever family! Name: Snippet
Description: Snippet aka Glinda is as kind as she is cute! This southern girl has a great personality - a little sass with a whole lot of sweet. She loves to play with her sister and foster brother (who is 70 lbs), snuggle up. on the couch, and play with toys. Those things only come second to treats and mealtime. She is doing very well on her potty pads and has been outdoor potty training in the suburbs over Thanksgiving - she has been amazing! Her and her sister sleep in the crate until 6am and either go right to sleep or cry for max 5 minutes before snoozing the night away. She had her first interaction with kids over Thanksgiving and did amazing - she let them hold her and played with them with no issues. Anyone would be lucky to have this sweet girlü§ç

Name: Frog Prince
Description: *Located in Korea* Meet Kkamie! Kkamie was rescued on the street after being abused and mistreated. He is well socialized and trained. He would love to be the only dog in a family, or get adopted into a family with a second dog that is calm and gentle. He is extremely gentle and super well behaved. He is ready to love you & be loved for life! My foster dog is good with: Dogs, Kids (he has no interest in cats) My foster dog is: Crate trained (but sometimes doesn't want to go into the crate); he is housebroken and goes potty on pee pads as well as outdoors. He only likes to make poopies on walks! 3 Keywords for your pup: gentle, well behaved, calm Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 5-6 outside, and 2-3 inside Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Quiet - he only howls right before going for a walk to let you know just how excited he is to go out! Walking Manners: Great leash manners, loves his walks! Appetite: she loves treats more than anything, but will sometimes leave some food in her bowl if she eats too many treats before eating Does the following: he does get car sick if he rides in a crate, but doesn't get as car sick if he sits in her person's lap. He might vomit if she gets car sick, but nothing too serious! He is very well behaved for baths and to get brushed. He also doesn't have any separation anxiety! He is very well-behaved during vet visits. Favorite Things: going for walks and enjoying a treat (but he does not like if other dogs steal her treats - who would?) Name: Router
Description: Hi! I'm Router! My foster mom calls me Vinny and she says I'm an absolute dream. If she didn't travel for work, she would keep me in a second. I love to play and my foster mom's friends brought me some squeaky toys which are my FAVORITE. I love to hang out with her and her roommate and my toughest decision every day is who's bed to sleep in at night. I'm a big cuddle bug and love some good scratches. I am house trained and will do just about anything for a treat. I haven't met a cat yet and I haven't spent much time with kids, but my foster mom would be really surprised if I didn't like children. I currently live in the East Village and while I'm a better walker on a quiet street, I love a late night walk before bed around a busy street because that means I get more attention. The only time I bark is when I hear the doorbell or if there is something spooky in the street, but each time I bark, my foster mom is a bit confused because I usually am a pretty quiet pup. I would prefer having a yard, but I've been good in an apartment because I get to go on a lot of walks. My tail does not stop wagging and I'm a magnet to my foster mom, but I can't wait to find my forever home! Name: Bash
Description: Bash is a very sweet 1-2 year old dog from Georgia. He has the most beautiful eyes and loves to use them to get lots of treats and food as he has a big appetite. He currently lives in a foster home with a 10 year old, male chihuahua and they get along well! Bash loves times with people and currently one foster parent works from home so he's not left alone longer than 4 hours. Sometimes he'll have an accident or overnight but not too often. He's scared of loud sounds and fast vehicles so we're building our confidence walking outside but he's a quick learner! He currently likes sleeping in bed with us but will move to the couch at times. Overall his routine is easy but he would do well with someone who works from home or has another dog in the home. Welcoming him into your home will mean someone who always greets you at the door, constantly has his tail wagging, and gives the best cuddles. Name: Cleo (Guava)
Description: Cleo is a total sweetheart and would make an amazing addition to any family or loving home. This gentle, affectionate girl adores everyone she meets, and is amazing with people, kids, and other dogs. She is fully house-trained, sleeps through the night in her bed, and loves going for walks, playing fetch, and curling up beside you at the end of the day. Name: Glinda
Description: **Located in Korea** Meet Glinda! She is surely going to be pop-u-lar! Rescue Story: As a puppy, she went home with a family that had four children. The kids begged to have a dog and, without any preparation, they family decided to adopt. As she grew, she began to shed, and the children became frightened. They decided to tie her up in the parking lot and left her there, neglected, for two years. The family that adopted her said that they couldn't take her with them when they moved, so she was abandoned in a parking lot and was unfortunately infected with heartworm (which has since been cured!) More About Glinda: Energy Level (1-10): 6.5 3 Keywords: Playful, Affectionate, Smart She barks when strangers visit, and sometimes barks as if she's talking when she wants something - a great communicator! When she goes for a walk, she gets scared when motorcycles or loud cars pass by. She's afraid of machine noises. However, she walks well without pulling on the leash. Despite her fear of loud noises when walking, her foster thinks she would do just fine living in the city. Favorite Things: She enjoys sniffing around and exploring! Apply to make Glinda your fateful sidekick today! ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. Name: Heirloom
Description: This little blue-eyed wonder just made a big journey into our home and is slowly finding his paws. He‚Äôs made so much progress in the last few weeks and loves playing with our dog, can't get enough treats, and will hang out and lounge around the house. He is still very skiddish if you try to touch, pet or pick him up so will require patience and lots of treats as mentioned. He's lets us give him treats by hand and is making good progress getting comfortable with humans:) He's playful, vocal (some whines and talking), but doesn't bark when people come to the door. Personality & Characteristics: Playful (with other dogs), Curious, Sweet, Gorgeous. My foster dog is good with: (Dogs, Kids, Cats). Heirloom is very good with my dog and loves playing with him. He's not been around a cat or kids so that would be something to assess. My foster dog is: (Crate trained, House trained, Low shed) Has not been crate train or house trained as we are still just trying to get him touch/pet/pick him up and that's been the challenge in getting him trained. Or Quiet Pup?: he sings throughout the day a bit when we wants something and he can make little talkative growls if he feels your getting too close but not aggressively. Name: Olivewood (Olive)
Description: Olive (we are calling her Charli girl) is extremely chill and easy going! She loves cuddling up and watching TV and is always happy getting lots of pets and tummy rubs! She is pretty good on a leash and loves going for walks too! She is completely house broken and lets us know when she needs to go out! Personality & Characteristics: very easy going and full of love! My foster dog is good with kids and dogs don't know about cats! Olive is completely house trained! We have not crated her! 3 Keywords for your pup: Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): very calm overall but can get excited getting ready for walks or when visitors arrive. Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: overall pretty quiet but when deliveries arrive she gets excited! Walking Manners: Good and getting even better! Appetite: Olive has healthy appetite! She does not beg for food when we are eating which is a first for this dog lover! Favorite Things: Olive loves her favorite blanket, tummy rubs and cuddles and going outside for walks. Commands/Tricks: Olive knows simple commands, sit, stay etc. but is learning more! ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. Name: Ashford
Description: Hello! My name is Ashford and I arrived in NYC in October. I'm pretty unphased by all the people & sounds, just happy to be here! I'm a sweet, energetic & playful boy. I'm friendly with everyone and don't react to other dogs on the street or bark, I just want to smell & explore! I'm crate-trained and have learned to go potty outside only. My foster parents are hybrid workers and I've done well with my new routine. I would thrive with a yard and more space to run around & explore, as I'm so curious about the world around me! I would be a good fit for someone who lives an active lifestyle & has time to work on training. Name: Cookie
Description: There is nothing sweeter than a warm cookie and new mama! Mama Cookie has recently joined our rescue and has just given birth to nine healthy puppies. At just two years old, we've now learned Mama Cookie is as sweet as her name. Check back soon for all the updates on Cookie and her bakery babies.

Name: Kloe
Description: Meet Kloe! Meet Kloe: The Chill Queen with a Heart of Gold (and a Nose Boop to Prove It) If you're looking for a dog who can handle the chaos of life with grace and a dash of humor, look no further than Kloe. Tantruming toddlers? She offers a comforting nose boop, then gracefully removes herself from the drama like the mature queen she is, even at the young age of two years old. Kloe is the gold standard of gentle play‚Äîexcited zoomies with adults, four-on-the-floor patience with kids, and not a single snatchy move in sight. She takes treats like a lady, has no interest in guarding resources, and frankly doesn‚Äôt even notice if someone strolls past her food. (We don‚Äôt recommend toddler taste-testing her kibble, but you get the vibe.) Her nighttime routine? Legendary. She potty breaks at 6pm and calls it a day. Even if you beg her from the backyard in your PJs, she‚Äôll be upstairs in bed like, ‚ÄúNah, I‚Äôm good.‚Äù She sleeps through the night like a champ and waits patiently for you to rise, whether it's 6am or a lazy Sunday 8am. Car rides? Loves them. Visitors? Welcomes them. Delivery people? Whatever. Kloe is unfazed by the world‚Äôs noise and just wants to vibe, cuddle, and be your loyal sidekick. One thing to know: Kloe prefers her personal space when it comes to other dogs. She‚Äôs not the dog park type, and that‚Äôs okay‚Äîshe‚Äôd much rather be your one-and-only. With people, she‚Äôs a total lovebug; with other pups, she appreciates a little distance and respectful boundaries. Think of her as the introvert who loves her humans but doesn't feel the need to mingle with the whole dog block. She‚Äôs the full package: calm, kind, gentle, hilarious, house-trained, and delightfully opinionated about bedtime. Come meet the girl who‚Äôs got it all‚ÄîKloe‚Äôs ready to boop her way into your heart. üåü In the home: Extremely chill and well-mannered ‚Äî not a jumper Total cuddlebug and wants to be snuggled up next to you ‚Äî and any visitors ‚Äî at all times Loves toys and playtime Potty trained and will stand by the door when she needs to go out Doesn‚Äôt chew furniture ‚Äî or anything but squeaky toys :) Not mouthy ‚Äî no play biting Loves lounging on the floor and only hops on the couch when invited Doesn‚Äôt beg for food ‚Äî minds her own business during meals Loves to play fetch and has a special affinity for hoses :) Crate trained Patient & loving with toddler foster sister üåü On leash: Very treat-motivated and easy to redirect with a tasty snack We are still working on leash manners, but Kloe improves every day! Kloe is the perfect mix of playful and relaxed and is ready to find her forever family.

Name: Abby
Description: N/A

Name: Sunny
Description: ‚òÄÔ∏è Can you be the sunshine for our senior boy, Sunny? ‚òÄÔ∏è We're looking for a truly special, patient person for a truly special dog. Meet Sunny , a magical 12-year-old scruffy Chi/Terrier mix. This 8.5-pound sweetie has a name that perfectly matches his goal: to find a patch of sun and snooze. Don't let his age fool you‚ÄîSunny is a spry guy with pep in his step! He loves walks, adores his humans, and is friendly with other dogs and cats. Sunny's Wish List: A patient, understanding human who can give him stability. A quiet, structured home where he can be the king of his own castle. A plush, comfy bed (he gives bonus points for a bolster so he can prop his head up! ü•∞) What Sunny Needs: After so much change since leaving the shelter in early October, Sunny struggles with general anxiety and can be somewhat vocal. He just needs time, patience, and a predictable routine to help him settle and feel safe. This is your chance to give a deserving senior the one thing he wants: a stable, loving home to keep him comfortable for all his days. He is so deserving. The love you'll get back from this magical creature will be tenfold. Can you be Sunny's safe landing? Vaccinated for rabies, DHPP, and bordetella, heartworm negative, and microchipped. Current on flea, tick, and heartworm prevention. Sunny has a neuter appointment on January 15, 2026; this appointment will be covered by Waggytail Rescue, should Sunny be adopted. To apply for Sunny, visit our website ( www.waggytailrescue.org ) for an adoption application. It is important to fill out an application as soon as possible for consideration, and we require a complete application for you to meet an animal. We are currently unable to respond to general email inquiries as an all-volunteer run rescue. If the dog is on our website, they are still available. Waggytail Rescue CANNOT guarantee the exact age of any adoptable dog, or final size of any of our adoptable puppies. We rely on the information provided to us by veterinarians, shelters, owner surrenders and other circumstances bringing the dog into our rescue. Adoptions: adopt@waggytailrescue.org

Name: Timber
Description: üêæ Meet Timber! Hi, I‚Äôm Timber ‚Äî a 15 lb bundle of sweetness and joy! I‚Äôm playful, loving, and always ready for snuggles. I‚Äôm crate trained, working hard on my potty training, and love hanging out with kids and other dogs. ‚ú® Personality & Characteristics: I‚Äôm a happy, gentle little guy who loves playtime, cuddles, and following my humans around. I‚Äôm affectionate, social, and full of puppy charm! üê∂ My foster dog is good with: ‚úÖ Dogs ‚úÖ Kids ‚úÖ Cats üè° My foster dog is: ‚úÖ Crate trained üöΩ Potty training in progress üêæ Low shed üîë 3 Keywords for your pup: Playful, Sweet, Cuddly ‚ö° Energy Level (1 = calm, 10 = high energy): 5 ‚Äî playful but knows when it‚Äôs cuddle time! üîà Barker? Name: Bombshells
Description: Meet Bombshells (Nala) üíñ ‚Äì a calm, sweet soul who‚Äôs slowly opening up to the joys of home life and companionship. Nala is a mellow, easygoing mama who recently arrived in NYC after raising a litter of pups. She‚Äôs still decompressing and adjusting to city life, but every day she‚Äôs becoming more trusting, more curious‚Äîand more ready for her next chapter. A little shy and scared at first, Nala finds her greatest joy outside with her doggy friends. She absolutely loves being around other pups‚Äîthey help her feel safe and confident. (A home with a friendly resident dog would be a big plus!) She‚Äôs also cool with cats and seems comfortable around kids, though she hasn‚Äôt had much direct interaction just yet. Indoors, Nala is a quiet observer. She‚Äôs crate-trained, house-trained, and low-shedding. She is easy on her own at home, communicates when she needs to go out and walks beautifully on leash‚Äîcalm, close, and with no pulling. She‚Äôs not a barker and has shown zero signs of aggression. Most of the day, she‚Äôs content to snooze in her crate or quietly explore a little more of her space. Her favorite hobby? Chillin‚Äô üí§ Navigating the building lobby and elevator still makes her a bit nervous, but with gentle encouragement, she‚Äôs learning to get more comfortable and build trust in her surroundings. Nala is currently on heartworm medication and otherwise doing great‚Äîeating well, resting lots, and slowly blooming into the relaxed, loving companion we know she‚Äôs meant to be. She would thrive in a calm, loving home‚Äîespecially one with other dogs‚Äîand with someone who‚Äôs happy to let her open up on her own terms. Ready to fall in love? Nala is waiting. üíï Personality & Characteristics: Very calm and happy to be resting, happiest outside and around other dog friends My foster dog is good with: Loves being around other dogs, good with cats, seems good with kids but haven't had the opportunity for much interaction with kids yet (expect she would be fine!) My foster dog is: Crate trained, House trained, Low shed, leash trained 3 Keywords for your pup: Calm, sweet, opening up Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 3 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Quiet Pup Walking Manners: Very good. Easy and walks right next to you. Appetite: Normal Favorite Things:Chillin Commands/Tricks: not sure ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. Name: Sensitive Gangster
Description: Hi, I‚Äôm Arty (aka Sensitive Gangster)! My foster mom can‚Äôt stop smiling about how gentle and loving I am. I‚Äôm an easygoing, affectionate guy who loves making new friends ‚Äî especially other dogs! I‚Äôd do great as a second dog (I love having a buddy!), but I‚Äôd also be okay soaking up all the love as your one and only. I‚Äôm calm and cuddly with a peaceful, gentle soul. I enjoy quiet walks, lounging nearby while you work or relax, and following your lead ‚Äî I‚Äôm a go-with-the-flow kind of pup. My foster mom says I‚Äôm housebroken and totally fine being left alone at home. I‚Äôm quiet, polite, and full of love ‚Äî the perfect companion for someone who wants a loyal, affectionate friend without the chaos. Favorite Things: Other dogs (!!), plain chicken breast,hot dogs, and the occasional cracker snack Knows: ‚ÄúSit‚Äù (and ‚Äúmelts hearts‚Äù ü•∞) If you‚Äôre looking for a loving, gentle companion who gets along with everyone and adds warmth to any home, Arty‚Äôs your guy. Name: Jose "Pepe" Garcia
Description: Hi! I'm Pepe and I'm looking for my forever home. I am the sweetest boy who loves to snuggle and play fetch. Once I get to know you, I will be your loyal shadow and love to make sure you are safe at all times. I've recently learned to sit and lay down with my foster mom and am getting used to the big city after spending most of my life in GA. I am perfectly trained - I only go potty outside and am always on my best behavior when I'm inside. I'm still learning to trust other dogs and can be protective on walks but I am getting more and more comfortable every day. I promise I will win you over! 3 Keywords for your pup: Cuddly, playful and affectionate Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 5 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Mostly quiet, can get protective when I hear loud noises outside or when I'm home alone Appetite: Normal, does not beg for human good Favorite Things: Fetch, Treats, Cuddling Commands/Tricks: Sit, Lay Down ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. Name: Islander
Description: Meet Islander! Affectionately calling him snappy this puppy is so silly, smart, affectionate, cuddly, and a fast learner. Snappy is completely food motivated, so lots of treats have helped him in crate training and house training (mostly) in a matter of days. My foster dog is good with: Dogs for sure! Curious about cats, also great with kids My foster dog is: House trained, mostly crate trained" poop pad, train and working on potty training on the wee wee pads," 3 Keywords for your pup: Goofy, loving, eager Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 5 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Mostly quiet! Quiet when you leave him in the crate when you leave home after he settles, but gets a little lonely if in the same house/apartment as you and he isn't in the room with you, will likely cry. Getting better at being alone and keeping himself entertained :) Love to cuddle snuggle, loves to sleep with you on your bed working on teaching him how to sleep on his own dog bed. Walking Manners: Improves everyday on the leash, just needs some encouragement with big noises and distracting people/birds/dogs on the street., extremely treat motivated so this helps. Knows to potty immediately after going outside on leash. Appetite: Huge Favorite Things: Sleeping in your lap, stuffed toys, sniffing outside, treats!, his daily meals Commands/Tricks: Sit, come, learning "Leave it"

Name: Leila
Description: Leila is a female Pit Bull Terrier mix born in approximately February 2019 and rescued in South Carolina. Leila has had a very rough start to life and has been working very hard with a behaviorist to erase the remnants of that life. Leila absolutely loves other dogs and she must have a doggy sibling in her forever home. Her forever place will be a single famiy home in a quiet neighborhood with a fenced in yard and no young children. Leila is crate trained and house trained, but she wants nothing to do with a leash. She can be talkative. Leila is a bit reserved when meeting new people and she is hoping to meet someone who understands it might take her a little while to warm up. Once she is comfortable, she‚Äôll love you forever! Leila needs a very experienced owner who will commit to continued training. Leila is a work in progress, but with the right person, she will flourish and the investment will have been well worth it! We know that special person is out there for Leila. If that's you, please apply online to adopt Leila at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. All pets are also current on age-appropriate vaccines at the time of adoption. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

Name: Shelly
Description: Shelly, a beautiful Pittie, was rescued from Manhattan ACC where she had been brought in as a stray, with broken teeth and was emaciated at only 24 pounds!! She is thought to have been born in 2015. Her foster mom has been taking such good care of her and despite her obvious neglect, Shelly remains a very sweet and loving girl, she is super smart and would do well in a suburban home with a fenced yard and an active family who can devote time to her and to make sure she gets enough of her favorite activity. . . chasing tennis balls! She is great with kids and people of all ages. She does not do well with cats, and slow introductions are required if there are other dogs in the home. Shelly is spayed, up to date on vaccinations, housebroken, crate trained and knows basic commands. Please apply online if you are interested in adopting Shelly: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. Name: Chestnut (TX)
Description: Chestnut (TX) is a male Shepherd mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that Chestnut is 1.5 years old at the time of intake in Dec 2022. Chestnut is good with people and other dogs. Chestnut was homeless wandering the streets doing his best to survive and not getting hit by a car. He was in need of medical care so we got him and he's healing nicely. All this guy wants is a home of his own with a family who will do anything to keep him safe and happy. In the meantime he is in a foster home and his foster mom says that he is the sweetest, most affectionate and playful dog. He likes to run, play with toys and with other dogs. he's very intelligent and a quick learner. If you can give Chestnut the best home with lots of love, kisses, cuddles, treats and soft beds, please apply online to adopt Chestnut (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Name: Riley (TN)
Description: Riley (TN) is a 2-3 year male Australian Shepherd blend (as of June 2023). Our veterinary partner estimated that Riley was 2 years old at the time of intake in October 2022. Riley is good with people and great with other animals. Riley is a very sweet boy who doesn't let his impairments get in his way. He is such a special fella! You see, Riley, is deaf and has limited sight. But no fears, that doesn't slow him down. He is well adjusted and a very happy boy! He is a fun loving fella who prefers to be with his person rather than be left alone in his crate. We suppose that is likely due mostly to the fact that he is sight and hearing impaired. If you would like very handsome Riley to flourish in your home as part of your family, please apply online to adopt Riley (TN) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. He is up to date on vaccines, microchipped, and such a good boy! Name: Sweet Pea (AL)
Description: Meet Sweet Pea: The Little Fighter with a Heart Full of Love! Life hasn‚Äôt been perfect for little Sweet Pea, but don‚Äôt tell her that‚Äîshe‚Äôs far too busy wagging her tail, chasing sunbeams, and melting hearts wherever she goes! At just 5 months old (as of April 14, 2025), this female Pit Bull Terrier mix has already faced challenges that would make the toughest souls pause. Born with bent front legs, her journey started with uncertainty. But Sweet Pea? She doesn‚Äôt know the meaning of giving up. She romps, she plays, she cuddles like the world‚Äôs most perfect snugglebug‚Äîand she doesn‚Äôt let anything slow her down. Our veterinary team is giving her the best chance at mobility with braces, but whether her little legs stay the way they are or find improvement, Sweet Pea is already perfect. Spunky, happy, and absolutely adorable, Sweet Pea is ready to find her forever family‚Äîthe one that will love her for exactly who she is. She‚Äôs microchipped, up to date on her vaccines, and will be spayed before heading home unless a medical reason prevents it (in which case, we‚Äôll guide you through it at the right time). She may have been dealt a different paw in life, but Sweet Pea is pure joy wrapped in fur. She‚Äôs proof that resilience can come in the tiniest of packages‚Äîand now, she just needs someone to love her the way she deserves. Apply to adopt Sweet Pea (AL) today at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Somewhere out there, her forever family is waiting‚Äîand we hope it‚Äôs you. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport suport for pets in foster care at a considerable distance from the adopter.

Name: Riley (AL)
Description: Meet Riley (AL), a charming female Pit Bull Terrier mix who was about 10 weeks old when she was rescued in early March 2025. Despite being a young stray, Riley is now safe and thriving, and she knows it! This adorable, sweet, and spunky pup boasts a unique painted nose that makes her even more special. Riley is up to date on age-appropriate core vaccinations and has been microchipped for her safety. Name: Ate

Waldos Rescue Pen is a 501c3 whose primary focus is rescuing dogs from the euthanasia list from high kill shelters throughout the United States and Korea.

Name: Savannah
Description: Savannah is a female Pit Bull Terrier mix rescued in Georgia. Our veterinary partner estimates that Savannah was born in 2016. We received the plea for help when she had been spayed at the shelter, and had somehow managed to break her spay stitches. This allowed her intestines to come through the incision site, and she was in critical condition and needed emergency surgery to repair the site. Savannah has been all fixed up and she is now doing well. Savannah is a sweet pup who is great with people of all ages. She must be the only dog in the home, and if there is another dog in the home (which we don't recommend), Savannah cannot be crated. Otherwise, Savannah does great in a crate! She currently sleeps all night in her crate and will rocket into the crate from anywhere in her foster home in response to the "Crate Up" command! She will also go into her open crate with a toy or snack and happily hang out there. Savannah is an excellent listener who will make a great companion! She is housetrained, knows basic commands and not destructive. She is easily overwhelmed with groups of dogs, and cannot visit dog parks. She seems to be okay on leash when there is one other dog around. Savannah will need a family who understands and accepts her issues with other dogs. If you can provide a stable, loving home for Savannah and would like to adopt her, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. Name: Madonna (GA)
Description: Madonna (GA) is a female American Pit Bull Terrier mix rescued in Georgia and estimated to be 2 years old at intake in September 2020. Madonna is a low-energy, super sweet, shy girl who is great with women and children, but fearful of men and quick hand movements. She needs a calm home and a gentle female owner. Madonna is good with other dogs with slow introductions, but is not a fan of cats; she prefers to eat in her crate and not have to worry about others taking her food. When we first found Madonna, she was tethered to a tree in the woods, with wounds sustained in an attack by another dog, as well as many scars and broken and missing teeth - signs of horrifying prior abuse. Madonna also had a non-cancerous mammary tumor removed; the biopsy came back as benign hyperplasia. We really want to show Madonna that life is full of wonder, love, companionship and can indeed be happy! If you can give Madonna that home, please apply online to adopt Madonna (GA) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Gideon is good with people who respect his space and he's good with other dogs, but cats--not so much! He is an adorable, albeit grumpy, senior boy who lives life on his own terms--he will let you know when you are violating his person or his space. He doesn't like cats and he doesn't like to be picked up; he likes to have his back rubbed, but if you hit the wrong spot, watch out! Gideon will do best in a home with snarky dog experience, where he can be independent, and if there are children they should be older and capable of respecting Gideon and his space. This guy's rough life has shaped him, and he deserves to spend the rest of his years in a loving, forever home with his special person who understands him and lets Gideon be Gideon. Name: Hatcher (GA)

But with love, care, and the resilience only a dog can teach us, he‚Äôs made a great recovery and blossomed into the sweetest, most joyful boy. Now healed and thriving, Hatcher is looking for his forever family. He‚Äôs a cuddly, happy-go-lucky pup who adores playtime, zoomies in the yard, and snuggles on the couch. He gets along beautifully with other dogs and is always eager to make new friends ‚Äî canine or human. Name: Gizmo
Description: ALL our cats and dogs are in the NY area but can be adopted out of state to the purrfect furever home. In some cases, we can help transport. Zani's al fresco Summer Adoptions follow us on FB to find us this summer as we will try new locations to meet the needs of NYC and support the little stores:) Handsome 4yrs old 45lbs Gizmo from Jamaica. All dogs are located in NY/NJ area All our puppies need puppy play dates/doggy facetime so we recommend homes with other pups or daily interactions to keep them tired out, happy and social. Facebook: Zani's Furry Friends ZFF (weekly adoption event info posted there) Twitter: zanisff Instagram: zanisfurryfriends Dogs are spayed/neutered, UTD on age appropriate vaccines, Rabies vaxed, and microchipped (not Lyme vaxed but we seriously recommend it!) All are in the NY/NJ area but we will adopt out of state to the purrfect home and in some cases, we can arrange transport. Please go to our site https://zanisfurryfriends.org fill out an application Many of us (cats/dogs) will be on display on Saturdays or Sundays, weather dependent--please ask by writing us at dogs@zanisfurryfriends.org and following us on FB. If you are seriously interested in adopting one of us in particular, please fill out an application early Friday so that we can be sure to be there. Otherwise we decide based on other variables. Usually we are in our foster homes so this is a bit more stressful and a slightly artificial environment but we do want to be seen and find our furever homes too. Please consider providing a home for more than one dog, especially if you are considering adopting a puppy. Dogs are pack animals and very much enjoy as well as need other dog company to learn to play, socialize and be good companion animals to people. The upside to this is that you won't feel as guilty leaving them alone and you get twice the love. Please come! And if you can't adopt, maybe you can foster or volunteer, and you can always donate! If you want to know about cats/dogs specifically being shown at our adoption locations, please email us info@zanisfurryfriends.org closer to the date so we know your interest and will make every effort to have that pet at the event or let you know how and where you can meet. It is extemely helpful and speeds up adoption if the application is filled out prior to visiting us so please do that before coming to our weekend events. Our weekend locations are: Saturdays or Sundays, weather dependent Follow us on FB, Zani's Furry Friends ZFF, for latest updates. Usually we are in our foster homes so all this is a bit more stressful but we do want to be seen and find our furever homes. Please come! And if you can't adopt, maybe you can foster or volunteer. And you can always donate:) Cats and Dogs are spayed/neutered, UTD w/ all age appropriate shots and microchipped. Cats are feline combo tested for FIV/FeLV; dogs are heartworm tested and rabies vax'd, (NOT lyme vaxed but we seriously recommend it); rabbits are spayed/neutered. Please fill out an application and email to: For Cats: cats@zanisfurryfriends.org For Dogs: dogs@zanisfurryfriends.org For Rabbits: nyc.acc.rabbits@gmail.com. Please visit our website zanisfurryfriends.org.

Name: Dixby Daxby (TX)
Description: Dixby (TX) is a male Shepherd mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that Dixby is 8 years old at the time of intake in Nov 2022. Dixby is good with people and other dogs. This senior boy was found living in the dirt abandoned by his owners. He had little chance of survival on his own but we've rescued him and got him the care he needs to start his new life. He is looking for a family that will cherish him and provide him all the comforts of a happy life. He dreams of soft beds and love. This boy is a DOLL!! Dixby is an adorable ball of energetic love! Though his past he endured neglect and heartbreak, he is a happy energetic pup! He enjoys head petting, love and playing in the yard and going on walks. His favorite thing is chewing on his Benebone and rolling around the rug! He also likes to cuddle on the couch, napping on your lap or having his paws touching you, he loves to be with his family. Because he loves to play a fenced in yard would be best for him. He's smart too and learning his commands, he is mastering sit, wait, come and off. This sweet boy is so full of love even after all that he has been through in his life. If you would like to give Dixby the happy life he deserves as a member of your family, please apply online to adopt Dixby (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Name: Beau (SC)
Description: Beau (SC) is a 70 lb. neutered male Pit Bull Terrier mix. Our veterinary partner estimated that Beau was 2 years old at the time of intake in September 2021. Beau is a super sweet, gentle, friendly boy who is good with people. Although Beau loves children, he's a big guy who doesn't know his own strength, so he would do best with teens and older. This beautiful boy was shot in the mouth while a drug warrant was being served; fortunately, the bullet lodged in Beau's neck in a spot that is not causing any pain or limitation. It was determined that it's best left there as the surgery to remove it is dangerous. Beau is a couch potato and LOVES to cuddle, is completely housebroken, enjoys car rides and does not chew or destroy anything (except for his toys which he loves to remove squeakers from). Beau would be perfect for a person or couple that doesn‚Äôt have other animals or has one submissive female (the only type of dogs he seems to get along with). He needs to be the center of attention so he can get all the love and attention he deserves. Beau is reactive to other dogs, so walking can be a bit challenging (he has a loud bark). Having a fenced in yard would be a plus. Beau can truly be your forever, loyal best friend if you crave pure unconditional love. You will be blessed to encounter this special guy. If you would like to star in Beau's new, improved life, please apply online to adopt Beau (SC) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. ************************************************************************ RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. Recently surrendered by his owner, Hudson arrived at the shelter with tired eyes and a few skin issues that speak to a life that hasn‚Äôt always been kind. But don‚Äôt let his sad expression fool you‚Äîthis boy is on the brink of something beautiful. Despite everything, Hudson remains a sweet, trusting companion. He adores people and thrives around other pets, greeting everyone with a quiet warmth that melts hearts. He doesn‚Äôt bark for attention‚Äîhe simply waits, hoping someone will see past the rough patches and recognize the love he‚Äôs ready to give. Hudson is neutered, gentle, and house-savvy. He‚Äôs not asking for much‚Äîjust a soft bed, a kind hand, and a home where he can finally exhale. Description: Hatcher: The Brave Little Explorer with a Wink and a Wag Once upon a time (okay, like a few weeks ago), a scruffy little Shepherd/Husky mix named Hatcher was found roaming the streets like a pint-sized adventurer. Name: Lotus (GA)
Description: Meet Lotus (GA), the sweet and confident companion! This beautiful girl is a female mixed breed pup estimated to be 1.5 years old as of August 2025. Lotus might be a little shy at first, but with a patient and loving guardian, she blossoms into the sweetest and most loyal companion you could ask for. Her adorable underbite and gentle nature only add to her irresistible charm. Lotus thrives on adventure! She'll happily join you on outings to festivals, stores, and even loud events as long as she's with someone she trusts. Imagine all the fun memories you'll create together. Walking with Lotus is a dream. She's a leash pro, trotting along gracefully without pulling, completely focused on her trusted person. It's almost like she disappears into your shadow, a constant and comforting presence by your side. But don't let her preference for a feminine touch fool you ‚Äì she's friendly and respectful towards everyone, including men. Lotus is a true gem, a bomb-proof companion around other animals and children. Whether you have other furry friends or not, she'll fit right in and bring a calming presence to your home. In fact, she loves to nurture and care for those around her. Give her a high-value treat, and she'll try to share it with you. She's even the first to greet new dogs and welcome them into her space, showcasing her friendly and accepting nature. This sweet girl might be a bit vocal if she feels something isn't quite right, but it's her way of communicating her feelings and protecting her loved ones. And when it's time to relax, get ready for some serious snuggling! Lotus is a professional at cuddling and will shower you with love and affection, a true furry shadow who's always there for you. If you're a patient and kind woman looking for a loyal, adventure-loving, and affectionate companion, Lotus could be the perfect match for you. Give her a chance to open her heart to you, and she'll fill your life with joy and unconditional love. Interested in giving Lotus her forever home? Apply now at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Our veterinary partner estimates that Cyle is 4 months old at the time of intake in June 2022, so he is about 3.5 years old as of August 2025. Cyle is good with people of all ages and other dogs. Cyle was dumped in a rural shelter with an injury. Cyle isn't a big kisser but he's incredibly sweet even after everything he endured. Cyle's foster mom reports he knows his basic commands and loves to hike and walk but also run free in his fenced in yard. He is a gentle giant who gets along with other dogs his size. He loves his toys and fresh sunshine. He is very vocal and wants to be involved in everything. If you're looking for a loving shadow, he is the pup for you. If you would like give Cyle the life he deserves, please apply online to adopt Cyle (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org . Name: George (TX)
Description: George (TX) is a male Labrador mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that George was 1 year old at the time of intake in Nov 2021. George is good with people, dogs, cats and kids! He would do best with a dog sibling and a fenced in yard. He loves to play and sits immediately when he knows it's treat time. He is crate trained and goes in when his foster family leave the house. He loves car rides and loves to play with his toys. If you can give George that forever home, please apply online to adopt George (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Name: Theo (GA)
Description: Meet Theo: Your Gentle Giant with a Heart of Gold Hi, I‚Äôm Theo ‚Äî a 3-year-old Rottweiler with soulful eyes, a goofy grin, and a heart that‚Äôs bigger than my paws (and trust me, those are huge ). Life didn‚Äôt start out easy for me. When I was rescued, I was skin and bones ‚Äî a shadow of the dog I was meant to be. But even though humans let me down, I never stopped believing in love. And now? I‚Äôm ready to find my forever person. Could it be you? I‚Äôm a certified snuggle bug. I‚Äôll happily plop my giant self right into your lap like I‚Äôm a Chihuahua ‚Äî personal space is overrated, right? I‚Äôm also a toy connoisseur. I carry my favorite squeaky wherever I go, like a toddler with a teddy bear. It‚Äôs my comfort, my joy, and sometimes my pillow. I‚Äôm a people magnet, too. I adore humans ‚Äî big ones, small ones, loud ones, quiet ones. If you‚Äôve got a heartbeat, I want to be near it. I get along great with other pups. And most of all, I‚Äôm loyal to the core. Once I know you‚Äôre mine, I‚Äôll be your shadow ‚Äî following you from room to room, offering silent support, and maybe a slobbery kiss or two. Despite my rough past, I‚Äôm not bitter ‚Äî I‚Äôm better. I‚Äôve got so much love to give, and I‚Äôm just waiting for someone to give me a chance to show it. I‚Äôm Theo, your big-hearted best friend, your cuddle companion, your toy-toting goofball. Adopt me, and you‚Äôll never be alone again. I‚Äôll be your shadow, your protector, and your biggest fan. Let‚Äôs start our happily-ever-after. Please put your application in here: www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org Please also be sure to reference his name as Theo (GA) in case of duplicate names within the rescue. Thank you! RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. Name: Jacob (GA)
Description: Jacob Needs a Home‚ÄîCould It Be Yours? Jacob (GA) is just 12 weeks old, and already he‚Äôs searching for the love and security every puppy deserves. This adorable Labrador Retriever mix has nothing but love to give‚Äîhis heart is wide open, waiting for someone to welcome him into their family. Hes full of love, charm, and personality. This sweet boy has the most stunning eyes you‚Äôll ever see--one aqua blue, the other light grey. He gets along with other dogs (he has 3 foster doggy siblings) and he is doing great with potty training--no accidents so far! He enjoys backyard time, takes peaceful naps in his crate, and walks nicely on a leash. He adores people, thrives around kids, and plays beautifully with other dogs. But despite his joyful spirit, Jacob doesn‚Äôt have a home to call his own. Every puppy should know the warmth of a safe, loving place to grow up. Could you be the one to change Jacob‚Äôs future? His adoption fee is $575. Apply now at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org and give Jacob (GA) the forever home he desperately needs. Please also be sure to reference his name as Jacob (GA) in case of duplicate names within the rescue. Thank you! Name: Polly (SC)
Description: Meet Polly: The Mastiff Mix Marvel! Hi, I‚Äôm Polly (AL)! At just 8 months old, I‚Äôve already mastered the art of melting hearts with my big puppy eyes and goofy grin. I‚Äôm a Mastiff mix, which means I‚Äôve got the perfect combo of gentle giant vibes and silly puppy energy. I'm going to be a big girl but that's all the bigger I can love you! My Story: I came into rescue with an embedded collar (ouch!), but don‚Äôt worry‚Äîthose tough days are behind me. Thanks to kind humans, I‚Äôm healing beautifully and ready to start my next chapter: finding my forever family. My Personality: I‚Äôm sweet as sugar with people and will happily be your shadow. I‚Äôm playful and friendly with other dogs, becoming instant besties wherever I go. I‚Äôm also an expert snuggler, tail-wagger, and treat enthusiast. Fun Facts About Me: I believe belly rubs should be a daily requirement. I‚Äôm convinced squeaky toys are the greatest invention of all time. And my dream job? Professional couch cuddler. Why Adopt Polly? Because life‚Äôs better with a loyal sidekick who makes you laugh, keeps you company, and loves you unconditionally. I‚Äôve already proven I‚Äôm a survivor‚Äînow I just need someone to help me thrive. Apply to adopt me today at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Please also be sure to reference this pet's name as Polly (AL) in case of duplicate names within the rescue. Thank you! Name: Betsy TX
Description: Betsy (TX) is a female border collie mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that she is 1.5 yrs old at the time of intake in June 2025. This poor girl was found on the streets, nearly dead, annorexic, tied to a pole. Her mate was left for dead, but she hung on. Luckily RDR got to her and she is healing up wonderfully. She is eating and gaining her strength back. She is getting ready to head to the Northeast where her forver family can show her she is truly loved! Please apply online to adopt Betsy (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Name: Missy
Description: ALL our cats and dogs are in the NY area but can be adopted out of state to the purrfect furever home. In some cases, we can help transport. Zani's al fresco Summer Adoptions follow us on FB to find us this summer as we will try new locations to meet the needs of NYC and support the little stores:) Sweet 4yrs 25lbs Missy from Jamaica All dogs are located in NY/NJ area All our puppies need puppy play dates/doggy facetime so we recommend homes with other pups or daily interactions to keep them tired out, happy and social. Facebook: Zani's Furry Friends ZFF (weekly adoption event info posted there) Twitter: zanisff Instagram: zanisfurryfriends Dogs are spayed/neutered, UTD on age appropriate vaccines, Rabies vaxed, and microchipped (not Lyme vaxed but we seriously recommend it!) All are in the NY/NJ area but we will adopt out of state to the purrfect home and in some cases, we can arrange transport. Please go to our site https://zanisfurryfriends.org fill out an application Many of us (cats/dogs) will be on display on Saturdays or Sundays, weather dependent--please ask by writing us at dogs@zanisfurryfriends.org and following us on FB. If you are seriously interested in adopting one of us in particular, please fill out an application early Friday so that we can be sure to be there. Otherwise we decide based on other variables. Usually we are in our foster homes so this is a bit more stressful and a slightly artificial environment but we do want to be seen and find our furever homes too. Please consider providing a home for more than one dog, especially if you are considering adopting a puppy. Dogs are pack animals and very much enjoy as well as need other dog company to learn to play, socialize and be good companion animals to people. The upside to this is that you won't feel as guilty leaving them alone and you get twice the love. Please come! And if you can't adopt, maybe you can foster or volunteer, and you can always donate! If you want to know about cats/dogs specifically being shown at our adoption locations, please email us info@zanisfurryfriends.org closer to the date so we know your interest and will make every effort to have that pet at the event or let you know how and where you can meet. It is extemely helpful and speeds up adoption if the application is filled out prior to visiting us so please do that before coming to our weekend events. Our weekend locations are: Saturdays or Sundays, weather dependent Follow us on FB, Zani's Furry Friends ZFF, for latest updates. Usually we are in our foster homes so all this is a bit more stressful but we do want to be seen and find our furever homes. Please come! And if you can't adopt, maybe you can foster or volunteer. And you can always donate:) Cats and Dogs are spayed/neutered, UTD w/ all age appropriate shots and microchipped. Cats are feline combo tested for FIV/FeLV; dogs are heartworm tested and rabies vax'd, (NOT lyme vaxed but we seriously recommend it); rabbits are spayed/neutered. Please fill out an application and email to: For Cats: cats@zanisfurryfriends.org For Dogs: dogs@zanisfurryfriends.org For Rabbits: nyc.acc.rabbits@gmail.com. Please visit our website zanisfurryfriends.org.

Name: Shadow (NY)
Description: Meet Shadow: The Littlest Tough Guy with the Biggest Heart Shadow (NY) is a 5‚Äì6 week old (as of 11/9/25) terrier mix who just escaped a kill shelter like a tiny, wrinkly action hero. He‚Äôs currently rocking some battle scars‚Äîsores on his eyes, ears, and face‚Äîbut don‚Äôt worry, he‚Äôs getting a little better every day with one of our fosters. Despite his rough start, Shadow is basically a marshmallow with legs. He loves people, adores other dogs, and has the kind of face that makes grown adults squeal in baby talk. He‚Äôs sweet, snuggly, and ready to be your sidekick in everything from Netflix binges to snack raids. Shadow‚Äôs looking for a forever home where he can heal, grow, and maybe steal a sock or two. If you‚Äôve got room in your heart (and on your couch), apply to adopt this adorable goofball at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Warning: extreme cuteness may cause spontaneous happy dancing. Please be sure to reference this pet's name as Shadow (NY) in case of duplicate names within the rescue. Thank you! Name: Anitta
Description: Meet Anitta (I call her Bella!) This adorable girl has truly blossomed since arriving in foster care. Once timid and unsure, Bella has gained so much confidence and now loves going for her daily walks she‚Äôs incredibly curious about her surroundings and enjoys exploring the world at her own gentle pace. Bella is wonderful with other dogs and people, and she picks up new habits quickly. She‚Äôs also fully potty trained and thrives on routine and positive encouragement. She‚Äôs still a sensitive soul who appreciates a calm, loving environment, but every day she shows more of her sweet, affectionate personality. With continued patience and love, Bella will reward her forever family with endless loyalty, cuddles, and joy. Plus, she‚Äôs hypoallergenic and adorable and low-maintenance! Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 3 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Quiet ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. The application can be found at WaldosRescue.org and once you are approved to adopt you will be put in touch with the foster to see if it‚Äôs a good match. We are a RESCUE not a shelter. We conduct veterinary and personal reference checks during the application approval process. We are unable to contact every applicant for every dog. We will select the best applicant for each dog, based on the dogs needs. Waldos Rescue Pen is a 501c3 whose primary focus is rescuing dogs from the euthanasia list from high kill shelters throughout the United States and Korea.

Name: Carmel TX
Description: Carmel (TX) is a Jack Chi mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that Carmel is 8 months old at the time of intake in October 2025. Carmel is good with people and other dogs and cats! Carmel was found wandering around by herself at such a young age. Just look at those eyes! This beautiful girl is super sweet and would love a home of her own. She is a happy girl who would love to be part of a family to play and run with! She is eager and willing to learn, she's doing well on a leash and eats up all the attention she can get. Can you show Carmel the love she craves? Please apply online to adopt Carmel (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. Name: Sydney (GA)
Description: Sydney (GA) is a female Pit Bull Terrier mix estimated to be 7 months old at the time of intake in November 2024. Sydney is up to date on core vaccinations (age-appropriate) and is microchipped. She will be spayed prior to joining her forever home unless there is a medical reason why it has not yet been completed (in which case RDRNYC will work with the adopter to ensure this is done at the appropriate time). Sydney is good with people and other dogs. We rescued this sweet girl from a shelter where she was taken after having been picked up by Animal Control. Sydney was suffering from a painful skin condition, flea and ant bites. Her fur has fallen out and her skin is raw and red. We don't know how long this poor baby has suffered like that, but she is now receiving all the medical care she requires and Sydney is well on the way to recovery! Sydney is friendly and sweet. If you can give Sydney the fantastic home she deserves, please apply online to adopt Sydney (GA) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. We can, however, provide transport support for pets in foster at a considerable distance from the adopter.

Name: Bronx (TX)
Description: Bronx (TX) is a female Husky mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that Bronx is 2 year old at the time of intake in October 2024. Bronx is good with people and other dogs. Bronx was found malnourished and in bad shape. Don't let this tripod fool you (she doesn't even know she has 3 legs) her spirit and attitude is infectious! Bronx's foster mom reports she is crate trained and loving life ! She gets along with other dogs and is a happy go lucky dog despite not having her leg ! If you check off all the boxes, Bronx is looking for in her family, please apply online to adopt Bronx (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org.

Name: Bogey (MS)
Description: Bogey (MS) is a male Pointer mix estimated to be 1.5 years old at the time of intake in July 2024. Bogey is up to date on core vaccinations and is microchipped. He will be neutered prior to joining his forever home unless there is a medical reason why it has not yet been completed (in which case RDR NYC will work with the adopter to ensure this is done at the appropriate time). Bogey is good with people and other dogs. This big, goofy, silly mush of a dog loves to be wherever his people are. He adores every dog he‚Äôs ever met--big ones, little ones, even the ones who wish he would go away! Bogey is not a fan of being crated but hasn't destroyed anything (except for stealing food) while roaming free. This handsome, fabulous boy is looking for his happy ever after with his forever family. If Bogey's path to happiness leads to your front door, please apply online to adopt Bogey (MS) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Name: Missy (GA)
Description: Missy is a beautiful 3yr old Lab/Chow mix weighing in at 54 lbs! Missy came to rescue from GA with a terribly painful skin infection and mange. Look how stunning this beautiful girl is now! Missy was extremely scared of people when she came into foster. She has absolutely ‚Äúblossomed‚Äù and is the life of the party in her foster family‚Äôs pack. Missy MUST have another dog as she builds confidence and finds much happiness and peace surrounded by other canines. She does well with male and female dogs of all sizes, and she must have a fenced yard to run around in. She is VERY shy and timid at first with human strangers and must build trust at her own pace. Once she feels secure, she turns into a playful, loving, affectionate girl who brings joy wherever she is! Missy is spayed, crate trained and house trained. She has very nice manners in the home. She enjoys her crate for her personal ‚Äúden‚Äù and finds security there. Adopter must be willing to allow Missy to open up and trust at her own pace and seek attention in her own time. I f you can open your heart and home to Missy and give her the time and patience she so deserves, please apply at http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Name: Rey (TX)
Description: Hi, I‚Äôm Rey (TX)! I am a 4 and 1/2 year old Lab/Plott Hound mix. I don‚Äôt mean to brag but I‚Äôm a very beautiful girl and I‚Äôm also very sweet! I really like people and love to play with older, respectful kids, other confident male dogs, and even cats! Are you the lucky one who will get to love me forever?! To adopt me, please fill out an application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application

Name: Lila (GA)
Description: Lila is a beautiful 3-5 yr old Lab/Vizsla mix weighing in at 54 lbs! This girl spent a majority of her young life on her own fending for herself without much socialization. Lila is learning to trust humans. She is an absolute treasure!! Sweet disposition, shy and very well behaved. Crate trained/ house trained beautiful manners. Lila MUST have another dog in the family. She is playful and happiest with canine companions. She truly is a pack dog and gains confidence surrounded by others. Good with all sizes, breeds. Lila has bonded with her foster sister Missy and would do well if they could be adopted together. She needs to have a very patient owner who will allow her to take her time building trust and seeking out affection on her own terms. She is a very low maintenance dog. Must have a fenced backyard. She loves to play with other dogs and she loves her crate for her quiet time and her own space. Lila has been spayed. I f you would like to learn more about Lila and are interested in adopting her, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. Name: Mindy (TN)
Description: Mindy (TN) is a female Pit Bull Terrier blend who came to rescue incredibly skinny, heartbreakingly so. She was estimated at the time of intake in Jan 2023 by our veterinary partner to be 4 years old at that time. Mindy is good with people and other dogs, is up to date on core vaccines, and has been microchipped. The face on this beautiful pup tells the sad story of Mindy's life. We found her in the euthanasia room of a kill shelter just minutes away from losing her life because she was suffering from a painful, itchy skin infection that was ravaging her body. We immediately pulled Mindy from the jaws of death, and now her face will soon be smiling at her promising future. Mindy is such a sweet girl, and she would love to share her future with you! (But no cats in this pup's future, please!) This beautiful girl is 50 lbs of love & snuggles! She is super smart, crate & house-trained and walks great on a leash. Mindy is very well behaved. If you would like Mindy to join your family, please apply online to adopt Mindy (TN) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Description: Mocha (TX)‚Äîor the Mocha Man as his foster calls him‚Äîis thought to be a male Rottweiler/Pincher mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that Mocha is 2 months old at the time of intake November 2023, so he would be about 2 as of August 2025. Mocha is good with people of all ages, other dogs, and cats. Mocha's foster reports he is great with everyone and dog and cat friendly! He is full of puppy energy and sweet kisses. He would do great in a home with a yard to run. His mortal enemy is cardboard boxes (he sometimes chews them). Name: Rosalie TX
Description: Rosalie (TX) is a female shepherd mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that she is 7 yrs old at the time of intake in June2025. This poor girl was found on the streets, nearly dead, annorexic, starving. Luckily RDR got to her and she is healing up wonderfully. She is eating and gaining her strength back. She is getting ready to head to the Northeast where her forver family can show her she is truly loved! Rosalie foster reports she is near perfect! She's affectionate, potty trained,her poops look good and healthy. She sleeps through the night, greets neighbors on our walks. Becoming more playful as she adjusts to home.life...She's a joy. Name: Alex (GA)
Description: Alex (GA) is a male Great Pyrenees mix rescued in Georgia, estimated to be 7 months old in October 2021 and likely to be 85-95 pounds when full-grown. His foster mom says he is a 'giant, crazy and insanely happy puppy!' All people are his friends (he especially loves men!), he loves other dogs, and even likes cats. Alex will do best in a suburban home with a fenced yard and an energetic doggy companion on the larger side who wants to play much of the day. He loves to eat as much as he loves to play. If there are children in the home, they should be on the older side: Alex really doesn't know how big he is! He's working on his chewing, mouthing, leash and meal-time manners - the usual puppy behaviors which will benefit from continued and consistent training in his adoptive home as he grows into adulthood. True to his breed, he can be stubborn, he is very smart and his big personality matches his size. He has a true zest for life, so he's a fun, interesting and busy guy! Alex has been neutered and microchipped, and will be up to date on core vaccines (age appropriate) at time of adoption. If you would like to take Alex home, please apply online to adopt Alex (GA) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org.

Name: Dana (NC)
Description: Dana is a playful, curious, snuggly and sweet pup who can't wait to bring all of that to her forever family. Dana is 4 years old and aproximately 33lbs, she is spayed and up to date on vaccinations. Dana is a lovely dog who enjoys treats, fetch, and going to daycare twice a week to play with all her many friends. Dana is great with all people and other dogs, she would do great with another dog in the home! If you are Dana's forever family, please apply online to adopt Dana (NC) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. All pets are also current on age-appropriate vaccines at the time of adoption Given technical constraints on this database, this pet's location may not be as listed here. Name: Dre

He was rescued from a high kill NYC shelter where he found himself moments from euthanasia. Dre is wonderful with people of all ages and other dogs. No cats for him. Dre would do best with someone who is retired, or works from home, as he has separation anxiety. Dre takes medication daily for arthritis and does have some accidents in the home. He's waiting to be your new best friend. Description: Sable (SC) is a female Boxer mix rescued in South Carolina. Our veterinary partner estimates that Sable is 3 years old at the time of intake in March 2022. Sable is good with people, kids and other dogs. This beautiful girl was picked up as a stray, and it's obvious that life has not been kind to Sable. She suffered from entropion, a painful eye condition, in both eyes which has been surgically repaired. Sable is very sweet, is housetrained, sleeps through the night, is great on a leash and ignores critters as she walks. She is great with smaller children and loves to give kisses to everyone--big or small. Sable has shown no sign of food aggression at her foster home. If you can find a place in your heart for Sable, please apply online to adopt Sable (SC) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Name: Bebe (TX)
Description: Bebe (TX) is a male Shar Pei mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that Bebe is 1 years old at the time of intake in September 2024, so he would be about 2 years old as of August 2025. Bebe is good with people and other dogs. He can be very active, giving lots of kisses and jumping around. He can also be very sweet and cuddly. He is not a fan of water. Bebe was found neglected on the streets, attacked by other dogs, trying to survive the best he could. Bebe's foster mom reports that he is settling in well and learning how to be a dog from his siblings. He is a playful boy and does love his toys and chews. We have taken him in and given him tender love and care. Now look at this young baby ! If you fall in love with all those adorable wrinkles, please apply online to adopt Bebe (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org.

Name: Bunny (TX)
Description: Bunny (TX) is a male Husky mix rescued in Texas. Our veterinary partner estimates that Bunny is 1 year old at the time of intake in October 2024. Bunny is good with people and other dogs. Bunny was rescued from a garbage dump where like many others, was left to die on his own. Bunny has been recovering and is almost ready to come to the Northeast. He only requires a fluffy bed, lots of toys, and a trustworthy human who won't let him down like before. If you check off all the boxes, Bunny is looking for in his family, please apply online to adopt Bunny (TX) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org.

Name: Austin (NY)
Description: Austin (NY) is a 7 year old Chihuahua mixed male who comes to rescue in June 2025 with his brother due to his adopters no longer beig able to take care of them. Austin is great with both dogs and people. He is a cutie who found himself in a scary shelter with his RDR brother and of course we coould not leave him there and pulled him into rescue. Austin deserves a loving home where he can be his silly self and shower you with kisses and love. If you would like to give Austin (NY) the life he deserves ,please apply online at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Name: Cloud
Description: Cloud is a spayed female Boxer mix rescued from a North Carolina kill shelter, emaciated and suffering from a life of neglect. Our veterinary partner estimates that Cloud was born in approximately 2017. She is a beautiful little petite pixie - 45 pounds of dynamite: a big personality in a small package! She's a total love bug and very affectionate with her people. Cloud is house trained, crate trained, has great leash manners and knows basic commands. Extremely smart, Cloud learns quickly and is eager to please. A high- energy girl, she requires daily exercise and stimulation. A fenced-in yard is a must. Cloud is dog-selective and although she tends to do well with large dominant male dogs who offer correction and leadership, she's not a fan of other females. She has a high prey drive, so no small dogs or cats for Cloud, thank you! Cloud must have a strong and confident leader. She is an absolute JOY, but not for a first-time dog owner or novice handler. She requires patience, direction and a family who will set her up for success and be vigilant in keeping her from bad situations. Her foster parents have worked with her on some food guarding tendencies, which result from her hungry times on the streets. Cloud is a great cuddler and good napper. Her forever home must be exceptional because she is an exceptional girl! If you are the special person who can open your heart and give Cloud her happy ever after, please fill out an adoption application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. This sweet female Labrador Retriever mix was rescued with her Momma and siblings after their owner moved away and left them behind. But Charlotte isn‚Äôt dwelling on the past‚Äîshe‚Äôs too busy practicing her puppy wiggles and perfecting her ‚Äúpick me!‚Äù face. With a Lab/Catahoula mix likely in her family tree, Charlotte is destined to be both gorgeous and delightfully goofy. Right now, her hobbies include: falling asleep mid-play, making humans swoon with her puppy breath, and attempting to walk like a baby giraffe on roller skates. Spoiler alert: she‚Äôs already the star of the show. Charlotte is the kind of pup who will keep you laughing, melt your heart with snuggles, and remind you daily that life is better with a wagging tail by your side. She‚Äôs sweet, funny, and absolutely irresistible‚Äîbasically the perfect recipe for a forever best friend. Don‚Äôt miss your chance to bring Charlotte home‚Äîshe‚Äôs ready to fill your life with love, laughter, and a little chaos. Description: Malachite (AL) is ready to meet his forever family‚Äîand he‚Äôs hoping it might be you. This neutered, male 7 month old (as of July 2025) Terrier mix has already been through more than most pups his age. He came into rescue with a painful skin infection, but thanks to dedicated care and lots of love, he‚Äôs now fully healed and absolutely stunning. His coat is soft, his eyes are bright, and his spirit is stronger than ever. Malachite has spent most of his puppyhood in foster care, learning how to be a happy, well-socialized dog. He‚Äôs great with people, loves other dogs, and even attends doggy day camp where he‚Äôs a total favorite. Friendly, sweet, and full of puppy charm‚Äîhe‚Äôs the kind of dog who‚Äôll melt your heart the moment you meet him. What Malachite needs now is a home that‚Äôs forever. A place where he can grow up loved, safe, and surrounded by people who see how special he is. If you‚Äôre ready to open your heart and home to this beautiful boy, apply to adopt Malachite (AL) today at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. He‚Äôs waiting‚Äîand he‚Äôs worth it. His adoption fee is $575. Name: Maw Maw (AL)
Description: Meet Maw Maw: A Senior Beagle with a Heart Full of Love Maw Maw (AL) is a 10ish-year-old Beagle who was picked up as a stray and traced back to a breeder‚Äîwho sadly refused to claim her. But Maw Maw didn‚Äôt let that rejection define her. She wandered onto the property of a kind family, where the children instantly fell in love and gave her the name that suits her perfectly: Maw Maw. Despite her age, Maw Maw still has plenty of pep in her step. She adores strolling through the yard, nose to the ground, tracking every scent like the curious little hound she is. She walks beautifully on a leash and is fully house-trained, always waiting to potty outside. Maw Maw is a gentle soul who‚Äôs wonderful with kids and other dogs. She‚Äôs patient, polite, and calm‚Äîan easy companion who fits right into any loving home. She already knows how to ‚ÄúSit‚Äù and takes treats with the softest touch. Though she‚Äôs currently very thin, just skin and bones, her spirit is strong and her heart is open. Now, Maw Maw is waiting for someone to see her for who she truly is: a sweet, spunky senior with so much love left to give. Please apply to adopt Maw Maw (AL) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org.
