Name: Zeus
Description: Meet Zircon (AL) ‚Äì The Best-Good-Boy You‚Äôve Been Waiting For! Zircon is a male Terrier mix estimated to be 8 months old as of August 2025. Zircon is already proving to be a shining star. He‚Äôs had significant training and outstanding socialization in his foster home, and it shows. This clever pup has mastered sit, down, paw, and roll over ‚Äî all with enthusiasm and a tail wag. He‚Äôs a social butterfly who adores everyone he meets, including dogs, cats, and kids. Whether he‚Äôs out in public or at doggy daycare, Zircon is a perfect gentleman and a crowd favorite. Smart, confident, and level-headed, Zircon packs a working cattle dog-type brain into a pint-sized body. He‚Äôs not just looking for a home ‚Äî he‚Äôs looking for a mission. He thrives on learning, pleasing his people, and being part of the action. After a day of play and purpose, he‚Äôs all about cozy snuggles and quiet companionship. Zircon would love an active lifestyle and a family who values his intelligence and charm. Ideally, he‚Äôd like a job ‚Äî complete with signing bonus treats, recognition for excellent work, and the occasional promotion. In return, he‚Äôll give you loyalty, laughter, and a lifetime of love. Ready to welcome this best-good-boy into your life? His adoption fee is $575. If you are Zircon's forever person, please apply online to adopt Zircon (AL) at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org. Please be sure to reference this pup as Zircon (AL) in case of duplicate names within the rescue. Thank you! Name: Dillon (MD)
Description: Dillon/Rocky is an 8-year-old Chocolate Lab/Doberman mix (38 lbs) with a heart full of love. He‚Äôs sweet, shy, and thrives in a calm, stable home. Indoors, he‚Äôs a perfect gentleman‚Äîhouse-trained, crate-trained, and great with dogs, cats and children. Dillon/Rocky loves being near his person, enjoys peanut butter treats, and will quietly keep you company. Outdoors, he can be a bit nervous around strangers or dogs, but he quickly warms up. Name: Lucy (Bailey TX)
Description: Bailey and Lucy (TX) are a bonded brother and sister duo who were born into rescue on May 5, 2019. Bailey and Lucy are Heeler mixes, although Bailey looks more like a Labrador Retriever. Bailey is a neutered male, and Lucy is a spayed female, and they weigh 45-50 lbs. They are good with people of all sizes and other dogs. Their ideal home would be in a quiet suburb with a fenced yard with an experienced dog owner who's very active and is home most of the time. True to the breed, Lucy and Bailey are equal parts super sweet snugglers and high energy whirlwinds and need to be exercised well every day. If you can open your heart and home to Bailey and Lucy (TX), please fill out an application at www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org RDR's adoption fees include the cost of spay/neuter/microchip at an RDR-approved facility, whether completed before adoption or if deferred because the pet is too young or has a medical issue. Name: Freya
Description: Freya - 5 years, 17lbs, Jrt/Chi Mix, Spayed This dog is eligible to join our foster-to-adopt program. Please email fostertoadopt@socialteesnyc.org with the animal‚Äôs name in the subject line if you are interested! Want to straight up adopt? Submit an adoption application a t socialteesnyc.org Level of dog ownership experience needed: BEGINNER: This means we predict this dog will be low on the challenge scale due to its breed/age combo. Potentially a good fit for someone who has relevant dog care experience (fostering, dog sitting) and is looking to adopt their first pup. Energy level MEDIUM: Needs a daily 60 minute walk or window of quick paced exercise (minimum) in addition to potty break strolls (10-30 min each). Also needs significant socializing opportunities outside the home and mental stimulation at home like tricks training practice, chew items, and puzzle toys. (This is regardless of dog size ‚Äì many small breeds were designed for lots of activity and will exhibit unwanted behavior when they‚Äôre understimulated.) Okay in the city? We don‚Äôt know yet. Most adult dogs do well in the city after they‚Äôve had time to adjust to a new environment, but some never adapt and need homes in the burbs. Potty trained? Probably! Adults usually are, but all will have transitional accidents for the first week or so. A consistent walking route and schedule plus finding spots with grass or dirt can help. Social with other dogs? Yes, but we don‚Äôt know to what degree yet. Some like to wrestle with every passing pup, others can coexist well but prefer to keep to themselves. We‚Äôll learn more soon. Social with cats? Not sure yet! Some breed mixes that are generally NOT great matches for homes with cats include large hounds, huskies, and shepherds. Comfortable with children? (ALWAYS requires adult supervision) We‚Äôre not sure yet, but we try to err on the side of caution. Respectful kids ages 8 and up are probably a safe bet. Children must always be monitored and taught to interact with dogs of any age respectfully. Medical status Healthy as far as we know. Up to date on their DHPP, Bordetella, and Rabies vaccines; heartworm tested if coming from the South or Puerto Rico ; spayed/neutered; microchipped; treated with dewormer upon intake How this dog ended up with Social Tees: Most of our dogs come via partner groups who help us save them from shelters where they are at risk of euthanasia in Tennessee, Los Angeles and Puerto Rico. There are very few spay/neuter resources there and many more animals in those areas than there are people to adopt them. Rescue groups like ours bring them to the northeast where the desire for pets like these allows us to save their lives. PLEASE NOTE: We cannot guarantee any breed mix, exact age, or full grown size (if the dog is under a year old). We do our best with very educated guesses though! This animal is not at the Social Tees office, all are in foster homes. LEARN MORE ABOUT US: socialteesnyc.org and Instagram @socialteesnyc

Name: Goldie
Description: Meet Goldie! This one-year-old, 47-pound sweetheart just joined Every Last One Rescue‚Äôs foster program, and she‚Äôs already stealing hearts. Here‚Äôs what we know so far: Goldie starts off a little shy, but she warms up quickly and greets new people with a wiggly body, soft eyes, and a happy, hopeful tail. She LOVES having a foster dog brother and is learning leash skills by following his lead. We think she‚Äôd truly thrive with a confident dog sibling to show her the ropes. She‚Äôs also proving herself to be a fast learner‚ÄîGoldie is picking up both crate training and potty training incredibly quickly, and we expect she‚Äôll have both mastered soon. After just a few hours in her foster home, she was already climbing into her foster mom‚Äôs lap for hugs and kisses‚Ä¶ a clear sign that this gentle girl is a cuddlebug in the making. Name: Soda Float
Description: Soda Float is the ultimate sweet treat for anyone who gets indecisive about the dessert menu! üê∂ Love a white dog but can‚Äôt resist a brindle coat? How about a sweet swirl of vanilla bean and chocolate chip? üê∂ Pointy ears or floppy ears? Soda Float has one of each! üê∂ Big dog or little dog? She‚Äôs the perfect pocket-sized pooch! üê∂ Snuggle buddy or running partner? Soda Float will happily do either (or both!), as long as she‚Äôs by by your side. Soda Float is 3 years old, 35 pounds, and full of gentle charm. With heart full of love and a deep appreciation for belly rubs, this sweet soul just wants to be near her people. Found as a stray and brought to the NYC municipal shelter, Soda Float has shown nothing but warmth and affection in her foster home. She lives for cuddles and will happily snooze next to you on the couch because her favorite place is right by your side. Want to play? She‚Äôs ready with a toy in her mouth and a tail wag just for you. Soda Float has learned so much since coming into foster care! After being in the scary shelter, she would much prefer to be near her people than locked in a cage, but her foster parents are helping her learn that her crate is a safe, warm, cozy place. Now fully potty trained, she happily sleeps through the night in her bed. She's also mastered basic cues like sit, stay, touch, come, leave it, drop it, wait, and touch; now she's working on a few just for fun, like "high five" and "spinnies!" Soda Float loves to learn and with her impressive hops, she might be a great agility dog! üç¶ Age: 3 years üç¶ Weight: 35 lbs üç¶ Likes: Belly rubs, puzzle toys, and baby carrots üç¶ Dislikes: Rats (but who can blame her?) üç¶ Demeanor: Sweet, cuddly, gentle, loyal, playful, mellow üç¶ Dreams: A forever home that values affection, routine, and quality cuddle time

Name: Diamond
Description: Meet Diamond ‚Äî a true gem in every sense of the word! ‚ú® At just 2 years old and 44 lbs, Diamond lives up to her sparkling name ‚Äî she shines bright with love, joy, and just the right touch of goofiness. Once she feels comfortable with you, get ready for a flood of affection, happy wiggles, and endless cuddles. She is timid at first and is best with slow introductions, but once she knows you‚Äôre her person, she‚Äôll be your loyal shadow and snuggle buddy for life. Diamond is dog-friendly and enjoys hanging out with her foster brother, house-trained , and knows her sit command like a pro. She also does well being left alone in the home. She is working on her leash skills and keeping calmer emotions when she spots new four-legged friends. She's also still building her confidence with meeting new people, solo walks and new environments. When she‚Äôs not showing off her playful side or investigating new toys, Diamond is happiest curled up next to you, soaking in all the love she can get. She‚Äôs equal parts snuggle bug and silly sweetheart ‚Äî the perfect mix of fun and affection. Diamond came into foster care with her sister, Nina, and while she was scared in the shelter, she blossomed almost overnight once she felt safe and loved. Now, her sweet personality sparkles brighter than ever, and she‚Äôs ready to share that light with her forever family. If you‚Äôre looking for a loving, loyal, and endlessly charming companion, Diamond is your girl . She‚Äôs ready to fill your home with joy, cuddles, and love.

Name: Tourmaline
Description: Thanks to a generous supporter, my adoption fee has been fully covered! I‚Äôd like to introduce myself. My name is Tourmaline, or Tourmie for short. As many of us know (and for those who may not be aware), Tourmaline is the name of a popular gemstone that comes in many colors, and my particular color is brown. Not to brag, but when people first meet me, they always think I‚Äôm a young lady, but to tell the truth, I‚Äôm over 10 years old. It could be that I try to stay in shape (I love long walks and even short runs!). Since it‚Äôs not polite to ask a lady‚Äôs weight, I‚Äôll tell you that I weigh about 50 pounds. It could be that as much as I like to just cuddle, have my tummy scratched, and generally just be loved (and give it back 10fold). Speaking of walks, I‚Äôm great on a leash. I sometimes do pull a little bit. I get a bit excited when I see other dogs being walked, but they're typically more interested in me than I am in them, so I'll just pass them by. I'm great with ALL humans, even kids! The only thing I‚Äôm not really fond of is being left by myself. I don‚Äôt make a mess, but I usually spend a couple of minutes calling out your name or asking you not to leave me alone. Of course, because we don‚Äôt speak the same language, to you, it just sounds like I‚Äôm barking. Otherwise, I‚Äôm very easygoing, especially when I‚Äôm snuggling, and I‚Äôm totally housebroken. I‚Äôll sit when I‚Äôm told to and stay when I‚Äôm told. I don‚Äôt really like to play tug of war, but I've warmed up to "fetch". I do like to make sure my human is doing OK, so I sometimes follow him/her to whatever room they‚Äôre in if I notice they‚Äôre gone. This might be because I was abandoned. I don‚Äôt really remember how I was treated before I was found, so it could also be from then. I love the little treats my current human brings with us on walks. They also use them to help teach me new commands when we get back from walks. I'm even allowed to sleep on the bed overnight. The bottom line is that I‚Äôm just a bundle of love looking for someone to love and be loved by!

Name: Holly
Description: Meet Holly ‚Äî Our Sweet Baby Hippo! Holly is a 60-pound cuddle bug in a tiny, low-rider package; more baby hippo than dog! She's got a big smushy head and even bigger ears, the perfect recipe to melt your heart. She‚Äôs a happy little soul who's sees the world as a place full of new friends and good snacks. Loud unfamiliar noises and environments can sometimes make her feel nervous. But if you let her go at her own pace and give her some reassurance, you'll see the silly, snuggly and playful dog she truly is. A little over 2 years old, Holly is as gentle as they come. Whether it's taking a treat or playing tug, she knows her stength and is very careful with it. She adores her toys and loves her people, so it‚Äôs no surprise that her favorite time of day is when she gets to enjoy both at once! While she can pull on the leash, she‚Äôs shown no reactivity towards dogs or the busy nyc streets. She is still polishing up on her leash manners ‚Äî mostly because she‚Äôs so thrilled to be out exploring. But with positive reinforcement, she‚Äôs learning very quickly to walk by our side. Holly hasn‚Äôt met a person she doesn‚Äôt instantly adore. She‚Äôs a pro sleeper, pro cuddler, and gives the sweetest kisses. She‚Äôs fully potty trained and tells us exactly when she needs to go out ‚Äî proof she‚Äôs mastered home life in no time. Holly came to the ACC as a scared stray and then spent weeks in a tiny pop-up crate. Now that she knows she's safe, her crate is a cozy, safe place and she'd be happy to snooze there while you're out. We‚Äôre not sure if Holly has had doggie siblings before, but with a slow introduction she‚Äôs done great with her four legged foster cousin in the suburbs! She‚Äôs a sweet, affectionate girl who gets very excited when meeting new friends ‚Äî both two- and four-legged! She knows her basic commands like "sit", "paw" and "wait" but she's such a smart girl we're sure she'll learn anything you want to teach her. Like any true new yorker, she's an avid subway goer and has been the star of the show at every patio happy hour! We've also discovered that she absolutely loves bath time. She sits so patiently, soaking up all the scrubs and affection like a little spa queen. Friends of Holly say she's the "cutest, sweetest, happiest and wiggliest little hippo you will ever meet!" We‚Äôre already totally in love with her and we think you will be too. Come meet Holly and we promise you wont want to leave without her!

Name: Jaguar
Description: Meet Jaguar! Jaguar has recently entered foster care with Every Last One Rescue, and this boy is oh so special. A longtime shelter resident, he was an absolute favorite among volunteers who couldn‚Äôt say enough good things about him. At 64 lbs and 2 years old, Jaguar is the perfect mix of playful and gentle! A truly lovely companion. His handlers in the shelter speak so highly of how he carries himself both in and out of the shelter, and we couldn‚Äôt be more excited for him to start this next chapter!

Name: Pippa
Description: Meet our petite brindle beauty, Pippa. Pippa is the queen of giving smooches and chasing tennis balls. She‚Äôs the perfect balance of fun and relaxation. Whether she‚Äôs playing fetch or going on long walks, she‚Äôs always up for adventure. But she‚Äôs just as happy to curl up next to you for a cozy Netflix marathon. Her ideal day? A bit of outdoor playtime followed by some quality cuddle time‚ÄîPippa‚Äôs happiest when she‚Äôs with her people. Pippa is looking for a foster or forever home where she can feel safe and loved. She thrives in suburban or rural environments where she can relax, soak up attention, and be the center of your world. Her ideal family is one that can spend lots of time with her, as she prefers not to be left alone for long periods. If you're looking for a loyal, affectionate companion, Pippa might be the perfect fit for you. All dogs will be altered, microchipped, and receive age-appropriate vaccines prior to adoption. Please note that the listed location for this dog may not be accurate due to technical limitations of this database and we have transportation options available within 6 hours of NYC (so don't let location hold you back)! Name: Hagi
Description: Meet Hagi ‚Äì Your Future Best Friend! üê∂üíô üì∏ Follow his journey on Instagram : @mariasfosterfriends Update 7/21/2025 He‚Äôs come so far and is so close to being ready for his forever home! Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs new: ‚úÖ Getting comfortable with new people , especially women (approaches them on his own terms!) üê∂ Plays well with dogs outside his foster pack and thrives around other pups üéΩ Wears his collar confidently ‚Äî leash training is up next! üß† Loves structure + routine , especially with other dogs to learn from üè° Needs a home with another friendly dog and a patient female adopter üíï Still cautious with men , but has made major progress with foster dad üéæ Total goofball with toys ‚Äî obsessed with fetch, tug-of-war, and running zoomies Hagi‚Äôs goofy, gentle spirit continues to shine. With the right home, he‚Äôll keep growing into the playful, confident pup we know he‚Äôs meant to be. 06/2025 Hagi is a 6-7 month-old Jindo mix who traveled all the way from South Korea and is slowly blooming into the quirky, cuddly pup he‚Äôs meant to be. He‚Äôs crate trained, potty trained, and a total pro with other dogs‚Äîbig or small! In fact, he needs a doggy sibling to help show him the ropes and build up his trust in humans. He‚Äôs still a little shy around people (especially men) but is making sweet progress every day. Hagi‚Äôs not quite ready for walks just yet‚Äîleashes are still a little scary‚Äîbut once he fully trusts his people, we‚Äôll be working on that. For now, he‚Äôs happy to hang out at home, toss around a chew toy, or get in a solid nap while you work. He‚Äôs not the snuggly-in-your-arms type (yet!), but he‚Äôll plop down next to you, sneak in some kisses, and lean in for scratchies when he‚Äôs feeling brave. And when he does feel brave? He‚Äôll invite you to a game of fetch or tug like it‚Äôs the best day ever. Quick facts about Hagi: ‚úÖ Potty trained and crate trained üê∂ Loves dogs‚Äîbig, small, and everything in between üß† Knows basic commands like ‚Äúsit,‚Äù ‚Äúinside,‚Äù and ‚Äúoutside‚Äù üè° Must go to a home with another friendly dog üéæ Favorite toys: balls, squeaky toys, and... socks! üåû Loves stretching out by the window and soaking up the sunshine If you‚Äôve got a pup looking for a gentle playmate and the patience to help Hagi grow at his own pace, he just might be your perfect match. Backstory: These two adorable puppies were rescued from the streets of Korea, where they bravely survived by scavenging for scraps and even eating newspapers. Tragically, their mother was euthanized at the shelter they were taken to, but these resilient siblings have shown incredible strength and love despite their tough start. Name: Alra
Description: Meet Alra (we call her Molly, and she responds well to that). Alra is looking for a forever home! She is the sweetest housemate, spending most days on the couch sleeping and cuddling. She has a lot of love to give and warmed up to us quick. She is house trained and loves car rides. She has not had one accident yet. Very chill around other dogs and people. She would be the perfect addition to any family or someone who spends a lot of time by home. She has a bit of separation anxiety but we have been working on it! She is very easy to fall in love with and gets so many compliments on her walks. Alra knows "sit" and "let's go" and is A good learner because she is sovery eager to please. She is so loving and affectionate, and has been very calm and neutral around other dogs. She takes treats really well and is very smart about understanding why she gets them. The only time she has barked is when I leave the apartment. She still has some separation anxiety, even though other people are in the house while I'm gone. Good with other dogs, low shed, very calm. At home she spends most of the day curled up on the couch next to me while I work ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. Name: Glimmer
Description: Short Bio: Glimmer is a sweet, playful lovebug who adores people, kids, and other dogs! This smart, food-motivated puppy is fully house-trained, sleeps through the night (preferably snuggled next to you!), and loves puzzle toys, cuddles, and learning new tricks. She's a happy, social pup who greets everyone with enthusiasm on walks and would thrive with an active family that enjoys both playtime and cuddle time. Personality & Characteristics: Sequoia is a velcro dog who loves being near her people when home. She's incredibly social, playful, and affectionate. Very smart and food-motivated, making training a joy! She's curious about the world and excited to explore everything on walks. My foster dog is good with: ‚úì Dogs (loves playing with other dogs and would prefer a home with another dog!) ‚úì Kids ‚úì People (she's super social!) My foster dog is: ‚úì House trained ‚úì Crate trained (can stay crated 3-5 hours with long-lasting bones) 3 Keywords for your pup: Playful, Affectionate, Social Energy Level: 7 (energetic and playful but also loves cuddle time) Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Quiet - jumps for attention when needs to potty Walking Manners: Still learning! She's excited about the world and wants to say hi to everyone. She sniffs everything and explores enthusiastically. Working on leash manners as she can get excited. Appetite: Healthy appetite - eats twice daily (morning and evening) Favorite Things: Playing with sticks and balls Fetch games Puzzle toys Cuddles and sleeping in bed with her people Playing with other dogs Meeting new people and dogs on walks Commands/Tricks: ‚úì Sit ‚úì Paw ‚úì Lay down ‚úì Come ‚úì Fetch/bring toys back Additional Notes: Goes potty twice daily (morning and evening walks) Sleeps through the night Can be left alone with enrichment toys Previous foster had her for 7 months Would do best in a home with another dog as a playmate

Name: Meta
Description: Meet Meta! Meta is a 3-year-old mixed breed pup with the sweetest personality and a big heart ready for his forever home. He‚Äôs playful, affectionate, and endlessly curious about the world around him. Whether he‚Äôs exploring the neighborhood, chewing on his favorite bone, or snuggling on the couch, Meta is happiest when he‚Äôs close to his humans. Meta loves meeting other dogs during walks but would thrive as the solo dog in his new home. He bonds deeply with his people and would do especially well with someone who works from home or is around often. He‚Äôs an easygoing companion who will loyally curl up beside you while you work, relax, or unwind. What Meta Loves: ‚Ä¢ Snuggling with his humans ‚Ä¢ Long, energetic walks ‚Ä¢ Chew bones and toys ‚Ä¢ Playing ‚Äústeal the ball‚Äù ‚Ä¢ Quiet time at home Great Things About Meta: ‚Ä¢ House-trained ‚Ä¢ Quiet in the home ‚Ä¢ Respectful of belongings ‚Ä¢ Friendly and comfortable with new people ‚Ä¢ Playful but also very gentle and calm My foster dog is good with dogs (on leash) My foster dog is house-trained 3 Keywords for your pup: sweet, playful, and curious Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 6 - He loves going on walks where he can sniff and explore all his surroundings, and daily 1:1 time playing steal the ball. Otherwise, he loves relaxing on the couch or anywhere his human is. Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: Meta is the chillest, quiet pup. Walking Manners: Meta is very curious and loves meeting every dog! He usually approaches new friends cautiously, and if they‚Äôre up for it, he‚Äôs always ready to play. He can get overly excited at times, but he‚Äôs learning how to stay calm. His leash manners are improving with every walk, and he‚Äôs doing great! Appetite: He's a hungry boy! Commands/Tricks: Sit, Paw, Stay, Come. Currently learning Leave It. Name: Arugula
Description: Arugula (Rugi for short), is a sweet, affectionate pup with a heart full of love and a bright personality. She‚Äôs silly, easygoing, and perfectly content lounging at home while you‚Äôre at work‚Äîno separation anxiety, no messes, just a chill companion waiting to greet you with tail wags and snuggles. While Rugi can be reactive to other dogs on leash and hasn‚Äôt been tested with cats, her ideal home would be a calm, pet-free environment where she can truly shine. Because she has a few touch sensitivities, she‚Äôd do best in an adult-only household where she can feel safe, loved, and understood. Personality & Characteristics: Rugi is goofy, playful, polite and calm My foster dog is good with: Rugi is leash reactive to dogs and would be best in a home without children. Name: Bellarua
Description: My name is Bellarua (Roxie/Roo). I'm the most lovable pet looking for my forever home!! I'd do best in a house ideally with a yard and/or another dog to get my energy out. I'm a little girl so still learning but I'm very eager to learn and responding very well to my fosters simple training and crate training. I love to lay all across my fosters and cuddle on the couch. I am good with other dogs on walks. I am kids/cats untested. 3 Keywords: Loving, excitable, curious Energy Level (1= calm, 10= high energy): 8 Barker? Or Quiet Pup?: I bark sometimes but I'm generally pretty quiet Walking Manners: so polite!!! Responds very well. I just don't like runners (they scare me) but I love saying hi to everyone and other dogs on walks, and sit when asked. Appetite: hungry & growing! Favorite Things: peanut butter mat, frozen treats, puzzle games, cuddles Commands/Tricks: sit, stay, and learning a few others. I also do not pull on the leash at all ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. Name: Patron
Description: Meet Patron! A soft-hearted sweetheart looking for her forever cuddle buddies. At 6 years old and 54 lbs, Patron is a true pocket-sized girl that often gets mistaken for a puppy. This beautiful mixed-breed girl is calm, quiet, and completely content to go at her own pace. She spent the first six years of her life in one home, so she‚Äôs now adjusting to big changes and is looking for a stable, loving forever family to help her feel safe again. Patron is an independent queen with a soft side. She may take a little time to warm up, but once she trusts you, she becomes incredibly loyal. She‚Äôs not overly clingy but will never turn down a chance to rest her head on your lap and soak up all of the scratches and cuddles. At home, she‚Äôs a total angel happy to snooze in her crate, relax on the couch, or hang nearby while you work. She‚Äôs house-trained, crate-trained, and fully okay being alone if you need to head out for a bit (and will be excited to run up to greet you when you get home!) Patron is super easygoing overall. She matches your schedule: want to sleep in? She‚Äôll sleep in. Early riser? She‚Äôs with you. She‚Äôs the kind of pup that just wants to be your quiet companion through whatever the day brings. Patron would do best as the only dog in the home. Her relationship to other dogs seems to be based in curiousity and timidness versus aggression, but she will need some patience and support as she becomes more comfortable and confident around other dogs. Out on walks, she gets excited and pulls toward other dogs but with a bit of patience and structure, she‚Äôll keep improving her leash manners. Patron is looking for someone with a gentle heart and a bit of patience, someone who will give her the space to bloom. And when she does, you‚Äôll have the sweetest, most soulful dog by your side. She‚Äôs calm. She‚Äôs loyal. And she‚Äôs ready for her forever.

Name: Apple
Description: Apple - 3 years, 35lbs, Frenchie/Pug Mix, Spayed This dog is eligible to join our foster-to-adopt program. Please email fostertoadopt@socialteesnyc.org with the animal‚Äôs name in the subject line if you are interested! Want to straight up adopt? Submit an adoption application at socialteesnyc.org. Thier Foster Parent Says: " Apple is the sweetest and most lovable girl! She‚Äôs an incredibly gentle and well-behaved pup with a curious spirit. Most of the time, she‚Äôs calm and cozy.. a true snuggle bug who could spend hours cuddling and soaking up belly rubs (her all-time favorite activity!). When she gets a burst of energy, she loves playing with her squeaky toys, throwing them up in the air, and showing off her playful side. On walks, she tends to get the attention of passerby‚Äôs with her adorable face and frequent head tilts. She‚Äôs a wonderful apartment dog who is respectful, mostly quiet, and happiest when she‚Äôs close to her people. She‚Äôs also getting into a good potty routine, typically going in the morning and improving every day as she adjusts to her schedule. She even enjoys her paws being cleaned with her doggy wipes when she gets back into the apartment (she treats it like she‚Äôs at the spa!). Apple is the perfect mix of affectionate, mellow, and curious, and will make an awesome companion in her forever home!" Level of dog ownership experience needed: BEGINNER: This means we predict this dog will be low on the challenge scale due to its breed/age combo. Potentially a good fit for someone who has relevant dog care experience (fostering, dog sitting) and is looking to adopt their first pup. TOLERANCE TO CITY City pup ‚Äì Seems unfazed by the sights and sounds, may as well have been born here. POTTY TRAINING Yes ‚Äì Few or no accidents COMFORT LEVEL WITH STRANGERS In between bean ‚Äì Fine with meeting new people but not particularly interested, kind of shy in busy social situations like a gathering or a packed day in the park. BEHAVIOR WITH CHILDREN (always requires adult supervision) Yes for most ages ‚Äì very confident, gentle, low energy, tolerant, not mouthy SOCIAL BEHAVIOR WITH OTHER DOGS Yes ‚Äì Good with most other dogs (sizes, breeds, etc.) as far as we know and enjoys socializing with other canines *** she will pull towards some other dogs because she wants to say hi but is very easy to redirect and keep walking. She can also be unfazed as well. We have only allowed her to socialize in very quick on-the-go interactions but seems good with other dogs. Used to live with other dogs - okay to be in a home with another dog :) RESPECTFUL BEHAVIOR WITH OTHER ANIMALS (cats, small pets, etc.) Okay to be in a home with cats - we don't forsee this being an issue and she came from a home with cats MOUTHY BEHAVIOR Past this stage‚Äì Little to no interest in chewing on stuff or putting things in their mouth that aren‚Äôt food. Doesn‚Äôt try to chew on hands, feet, etc. during playtime SEPARATION ANXIETY (Please leave your foster dog home alone every day for at least 20 minutes.) Past this stage ‚Äì Completely fine being left home alone. Doesn‚Äôt cry or exhibit destructive behavior when you leave the apartment or house. LEASH MANNERS Getting the hang of it ‚Äì Probably hasn‚Äôt been on a leash much in their life but figuring it out. Might be a mild puller but responds to correction. CUDDLE BUG LEVEL High ‚Äì Wants to be in your lap pretty much all the time JUMPING ON PEOPLE TO SAY HELLO Calm Greetings ‚Äì Doesn‚Äôt jump up on people or dogs. Always all four on the floor. CRATE TRAINING Yep/mostly ‚Äì Seems comfortable in the crate, may whine a little at first but settles pretty quickly. We use the crate when we leave the pup alone and/or at night. *** we left her in the crate when we were at work for the first few days and she would walk into it when we pointed at it without using any words. She seems to be used to it and falls asleep but she is very good so we don‚Äôt put her in the crate anymore. She sleeps in her dog bed in our room at night, not in the crate. Medical status Healthy as far as we know. Recovering from an ear infection - common for the breed mix. Up to date on their DHPP, Bordetella, and Rabies vaccines; heartworm negative; spayed/neutered; microchipped; treated with dewormer upon intake How this dog ended up with Social Tees: Most of our dogs come via partner groups who help us save them from shelters where they are at risk of euthanasia in Tennessee, Puerto Rico or Southern California. There are very few spay/neuter resources there and many more animals in those areas than there are people to adopt them. Rescue groups like ours bring them to the northeast where the desire for pets like these allows us to save their lives. PLEASE NOTE: We cannot guarantee any breed mix, exact age, or full grown size (if the dog is under a year old). We do our best with very educated guesses though! This animal is not at the Social Tees office, all are in foster homes. LEARN MORE ABOUT US: socialteesnyc.org and Instagram @socialteesnyc

Name: Lolo
Description: Lolo‚Äôs story begins in one of the most heartbreaking places imaginable‚Äîan infamous Mississippi dumpsite where unwanted animals are cruelly discarded like trash. It‚Äôs a place where hope goes to die‚Ä¶ but Lolo survived. Abandoned and left to fend for herself, Lolo defied the odds. She‚Äôs since blossomed into the most gentle, affectionate companion you could ask for. Despite what she‚Äôs been through, her heart is wide open‚Äîready to trust, ready to love, and ready to begin again. Lolo is: üêæ Dog- and cat-friendly üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Great with people üö∂‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Loves easy walks and peaceful adventures üè° A perfect fit for both apartment life or a home with a yard. She‚Äôs not just looking for a home‚Äî she‚Äôs looking for someone who sees her past, honors her journey, and welcomes her future with open arms. üí´ Lolo is proof that even the most broken places can produce something beautiful. All dogs will be altered, microchipped, and receive age-appropriate vaccines prior to adoption. Name: Ion
Description: He LOVES other people (kids too!) and other dogs. He is curious about cats but hasn‚Äôt had much experience with them. He is crate trained, potty trained, knows most commands (sit, lie down, paw, is working on stay), is very food motivated and smart so is super trainable, sleeps through the night, loves playing tug, and loves belly runs. He‚Äôll bring you a shoe as a gift when you arrive home and will play tug with it if you try to take it from him but doesn‚Äôt chew or destroy people-objects (just his toys and bones). He eventually just puts the shoe down (or will drop it for a treat!). He‚Äôs a cuddly sweet guy! He is pretty mellow during the day but likes a romp in the morning and evening. He is very social and seeks engagement so a home with multiple adults/children and with some greenspace (even a small yard) would be ideal. He is ok in the city, a bit scared of the loud noises and overhead trains, but otherwise fine. He is quite the food scavenger! I think he‚Äôd thrive best in the suburbs or upstate. He‚Äôs still working on his leash skills‚Äîcan vacillate between pulling and being a bit resistant but is trainable. He‚Äôs also still working on recall and consistently responding to his name. He has a bit of resource guarding around bed and can be a bit jumpy if he‚Äôs woken up, so I recommend he not sleep in human‚Äôs bed (he sleeps in his crate with the door open) and couch cuddles only once you‚Äôve grown familiar with one another. He loves smelling things and is endless curious about nature. Personality & Characteristics: The Ultimate Cuddle Bug & People Pleaser: Ion is simply the most snuggly and friendly pup you'll ever meet! The moment you sit down, he'll be right there, laying on your lap and gazing at you with the most loving eyes. He adores leaning on people and will even sit on your feet for extra closeness. Whip-Smart & A Training Superstar: We're not exaggerating ‚Äì Ion is incredibly smart and genuinely the easiest dog to train ever! He's picked up a remarkable number of commands in just a few days, including sit, stay, lay, come, look at me, bed, crate, spin, leave it, paw, and even "follow" (he'll politely wait for you to go through doors first!). His food motivation makes learning a breeze! Perfectly Sized Companion: Everyone who meets Ion comments on his ideal size, making him a great fit for various living situations. Energy Matcher Extraordinaire: Ion is a true chameleon when it comes to energy! If you're feeling playful or a little anxious, he'll be ready to join in the fun. But if you're in a calm mood, he's just as happy to roll over for some delightful belly scratches. Quiet & Content: In our apartment, Ion is quite calm, usually a 3-4 on the energy scale, spending most of his day napping, with short bursts of playtime like tug-of-war. He's generally a quiet pup, only barking when it's time for a meal! House Trained & Crate Comfortable: Ion is fully house-trained and crate-trained. He sleeps soundly in his crate by himself. While he's still perfecting being left home alone (he might whine a bit initially but settles quickly), he's always calm and happy upon our return. Food Motivated: Loves treats, which are great for training and managing his mild separation anxiety. Sunbathing & Snuggles: His favorite things include soaking up the sun and getting lots of cuddles. Loves Kids: This sweet pup absolutely adores children and is always eager to say hello! Good with Dogs (with a caveat): He's successfully lived with four other dogs and isn't reactive on walks. However, he's a bit selective with his canine companions and may do best as the only dog or with a calm, tolerant buddy after a slow introduction. Low to Medium Shed: Easy to keep clean, with less shedding in cooler weather. Dream Home: Ion will thrive with a family who can shower him with cuddles and continue to reinforce his already impressive training with gentle reminders as he settles in. See More of Ion! Follow his adorable adventures and daily updates on Instagram: @adopt.ion.nyc ALL adoptions require a completed application and final contract. The application can be found at WaldosRescue.org and once you are approved to adopt you will be put in touch with the foster to see if it‚Äôs a good match. We are a RESCUE not a shelter. We conduct veterinary and personal reference checks during the application approval process. We are unable to contact every applicant for every dog. We will select the best applicant for each dog, based on the dogs needs. Waldos Rescue Pen is a 501c3 whose primary focus is rescuing dogs from the euthanasia list from high kill shelters throughout the United States and Korea.

Name: Benito
Description: Meet Benito When we first saw Benito at the Queens NYCACC we knew this quiet but soulful boy would have a very slim chance of adoption. A true underdog, he had double cherry eye, a black coat, and a ‚Äúbigger‚Äù dog. After putting in the work to be the bestest boy he can be, Benito is finally ready for his big debut. Over the many weeks with his foster, they‚Äôve worked together on invaluable skills and he‚Äôs taken to them like a natural. Benito has shown us his spunky and social personality - he‚Äôs a lover of fetch, friendly with people, and now able to coexist with dogs his size. Benito would make an excellent addition in an adult only home as a solo pet. The perfect family lifestyle would be an active one filled with walks, hikes, playing fetch, and guardians willing to continue with his training. Daily socialization with dogs that match him well would be integral to reinforce his amazing progress. Another example of ‚Äúit takes a village,‚Äù we cannot thank the fosters that have helped him reach this milestone in his journey. This happy, healthy, glowing young pup is ready for his second chance! If you‚Äôre interested in fostering or adopting, reach out to us or submit an application via the link in our bio. Benito‚Äôs adoption fee is $300 and to show how dedicated we are to his success, we will continue to support his ongoing training.

Name: Billy
Description: Meet Billy | Apply Here Billy is a 6-month-old neutered male Jindo mix with a warm tan-and-white coat and plenty of puppy charm. He‚Äôs 12.5 kg (27.6 lbs), playful, curious, and ready to explore the world with a new human by his side. Whether he‚Äôs learning new routines or making you laugh, Billy‚Äôs a classic happy-go-lucky pup with a lot of potential.

Name: Sun
Description: Meet Sun | Apply Here | Videos This wonder pup is a 3 year old Old English Sheepdog and weighs 55lbs. His floof of a coat blows in the wind like a real life Fabio and his body still has the floppiness of a puppy. During one of our spay and neuter clinics at our facility in Bundang, a local shelter brought Sun in to get neutered. As soon as our rescue manager saw him, she insisted we take him and help his journey. With personal experience with the breed, she knew how lovely this uncommon pup was, and how low his chance of adoption would be with his size. Now in foster care, Sun is continuing to find himself and grow in many ways. On walks, he is beauty and grace and captivates the attention of many as he holds his nose up to the wind. He‚Äôs getting better at his leash walking manners by the day; though he is easily distracted, his quick-to-learn nature is helping him learn that engagement is key! Inside, he‚Äôs a walking and breathing shag rug, often sprawled out on the bare floors and splooting in good form. He enjoys chewing and playing with toys, sniffing anything he can get his nose on, and more than anything taking a good nap. Sun is looking for an adult-only household , ideally outside of Manhattan , where he can continue to thrive and grow. This handsome guy is waiting for his happily ever after‚Äîonce you‚Äôve got your sheep in a row, submit your application and come meet him at the adoption event! Name: Lau
Description: Meet Lau | Apply Here | Videos Long lady Lau is 7 months old, and 28lbs of length and legs. She was rescued alongside many of our recent puppies during the Andong wildfires with her mom and sister. After having some fun and training at our center in Bundang, Lau is really to take the city by storm. She‚Äôs quite the confident walker and makes heads turn with how elegant she looks. She‚Äôs mastered the doe eyes and will use them anytime she wants attention or love. She‚Äôs also taken quite well to her foster sibling and initiates play wrestling! Name: Benson
Description: Meet Benson | Apply Here Benson is a 3-year-old miniature Poodle with a bouncy personality and an expressive little face that makes everyone smile. Weighing just under 14 lbs , he‚Äôs the perfect size for apartment living or a home with limited space, but don‚Äôt let his size fool you‚Äîhe‚Äôs got a heart full of curiosity and charm. He enjoys attention, walks, and cozy companionship, and he‚Äôs easy to handle thanks to his manageable size and temperament. If you‚Äôre looking for a sweet, compact companion who can match your pace, Benson might be your guy.
